{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","title":"Porsche Museum | Mercedes-Benz Museum","link":"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/stuttgart-porsche-museum-mercedes-benz-museum","description":"<figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430286189856-XULYVVF1HW4U1KPGVHTD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55406f6ce4b027b466518762\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430286189856-XULYVVF1HW4U1KPGVHTD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I recently returned from a trip to Europe visiting Paris, Stuttgart, Munich, Venice, and Milan. I apologize for my extended hiatus – which was primarily due to the trip but also because of some personal matters. Readers that have heard of my visit to Europe have asked me to post a travel guide of places I've visited&#160;but I think I’ll have to pass this time. The primary reason is that I don’t think I’ve spent enough time in the cities I've visited to form a solid enough list of recommendations. The secondary reason is that I’ve been sent a few things to review, and these requests will have to take priority.&#160;</p><p>Nevertheless, I know that many readers are fans of cars like myself, so I thought I should at&#160;minimum share some of my photos from the Porsche and Mercedes-Benz Museums. Enjoy.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.porsche.com/museum/en/\">Porsche Museum</a></h2><p class=\"text-align-center\"><span>★★★★</span><br /><span>Porscheplatz 1, 70435 Stuttgart, Germany</span><br /><span>Admission &#160;</span><span>8&#160;</span><span>€</span></p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430286262276-SZSXJC8MC52HNM65SYR6/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55406fb0e4b011fc426cbd3f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430286262276-SZSXJC8MC52HNM65SYR6/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The entire reason for visiting Stuttgart was to visit the Porsche Museum. Porsche best exemplifies good design values, and has an opinionated approach that I appreciate. I see them as<span>&#160;a car company with an unbeatable lineup of vehicles that was achieved through an approach that's not unlike Apple.</span>&#160;The&#160;Museum is designed by Delugan Meissl and located near the company’s headquarters. If you're simply a fan of design, this&#160;one is worth a visit even if you don't care much about&#160;cars. The museum is&#160;executed meticulously, and tells a brilliant story using great graphic design and installations.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55407054e4b0bcf3f1310be5\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430286421440-LFQD33KU47DZ4AOR8T49/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The exhibition space was designed by HG Merz and features a layout that is as concise and logical as the brand itself. The Museum is structured using a chronological timeline of the company’s cars in a linear manner. As you move through the company’s history, you begin to understand the values that structure the backbone of the brand, like the concept of consistency and lightness. I’m a fan of ordered, linear exhibitions and the round tour is the perfect example of a well conceived one.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Simplicity, and the idea of rational evolution are probably the strongest traits of Porsche as a brand. This is what really strikes you move through the Porsche museum. Every car that Ferdinand Porsche has worked on, like the 1939 Type 64 seems to point&#160;in the inevitable direction of today’s 911. There are very few products and even less brands that can really demonstrate this level of purity in vision. Even someone that knows nothing about Porsche can see the clear lineage here, and that's a powerful thing.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430348467746-W477BGXAKX2R0X59BMMF/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"554162afe4b00db6937616e6\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430348467746-W477BGXAKX2R0X59BMMF/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Visually, the 1962 Porsche 804 F1 car was one of the highlights in the museum for me due to it’s simple elegance. This was a bit of a controversial project at the time because the questionable marketability of technology developed through F1 on road cars. It’s no surprise that Porsche withdrew from F1 at the end of the season. Regardless of it’s short history, the tiny, mid mounted, air-cooled boxer 8-cylinder machine would be an amazing thing to play with.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430373265881-IIYKZH184QY43ZBA4K49/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5541c390e4b0d0fcaab30f8f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430373265881-IIYKZH184QY43ZBA4K49/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I was also drawn to the Porsche 908 KH and the 904 which sat in the same room as the 804. The 908 KH (white) is honestly a bit of a mess but it sits so low and wide that you can’t help but be impressed by it’s charisma. The 904 (silver), also called Carrera GTS, is the real beauty here with its classic form and classic silver paint job. Like every car in this museum, it begins to tell a story of evolution, in this case, it's&#160;one that leads to the 917. There’s also some modern Porsche here, and you can easily see a bit of the 918, 919 Hybrid and even Cayman in these cars.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><span>More photos</span></p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430363965653-NAUTY9XAIGX93Y8JTTN3/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<hr /><h2 class=\"text-align-center\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.mercedes-benz.com/en/mercedes-benz/classic/museum/\">Mercedes-Benz&#160;Museum</a></h2><p class=\"text-align-center\"><span>★★★</span><span>★</span><br /><span>Mercedesstraße 100, 70372 Stuttgart, Germany<br />Admission &#160;</span><span>8&#160;</span><span>€</span></p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430361721639-XGG6RHHRXFIMLYWQRLP2/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55419674e4b0e4fc04f1daa2\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430361721639-XGG6RHHRXFIMLYWQRLP2/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>When you're a company that can say that you’ve invented the market you compete in, there’s a lot to say. There’s just so much history behind the&#160;three-pointed star. Porsche, like the cars they make are simple. They make sports cars that are&#160;consistent and rational. Mercedes-Benz is complex. They make everything from the finest luxury sedans to utilitarian trucks. This is how I felt about the Mercedes-Benz museum. Despite having a relatively linear spiral floor plan like Porsche (even designed by the same designer), the story felt too overwhelming to consume&#160;on one visit. It’s a great museum that tells a grand story&#160;but be prepared to leave feeling more confused about the brand than ever before.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55419741e4b029f3456db644\" data-type=\"image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430361949726-YBYVRH3BASYCUOVIPI79/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55419754e4b029f3456db6bd\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430361949726-YBYVRH3BASYCUOVIPI79/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Next door to the Mercedes-Benz Museum is a sales center that features pretty much every vehicle the company currently makes. There are so many cars here that this building in itself is enough to spend an entire afternoon. The highlight for me was without a doubt, the AMG GT. I’m not a big fan of Mercedes’ new heavily surfaced design language but the AMG GT has a strong presence (especially with the noise its 4.9L V8 makes) that I can see distracting&#160;911 buyers. Thanks to the long hood, the side profile is particularly attractive. &#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"20150408-L1000510.jpg\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5541b811e4b0847de60d580c\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430370326786-PRS84UVXL614SOWQ6QLI/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/20150408-L1000510.jpg?format=1000w\"        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The journey&#160;begins with an ascend in a science fiction looking elevator. Once you get off at the top floor, the first thing on display is a horse, not a car. This is one of the most memorable moments of the museum for me. It’s humbling to think that&#160;they’re able to bookend their legacy with the horse and their F 015 concept car.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430364054293-ZBY9YIMKF15N0IIF3MA5/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55419f94e4b0e503f8166d9d\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430364054293-ZBY9YIMKF15N0IIF3MA5/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The Legend of Mercedes-Benz starts here with Gottlieb Daimler and Carl Benz, who&#160;created the first two autmobiles in 1886 – the Benz Patent Motor Car and the Daimler Motorized Carriage. Both cars have their own benefits, the Patent Motor Car was designed from the ground up, and therefore more modern, which is evident by its isolated, rear mounted engine. The Motorized Carriage on the other hand is architecturally just a modified carriage but features a more advanced engine; the “Grandfather Clock”, which Mecerdes-Benz likes to tout as the “world’s first small high-speed internal combustion engine to run on gasoline”.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5541be33e4b03ffbb5752fe1\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430371893262-YVW58E8NEBRG8HW42XD8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The Museum is composed of over 160 vehicles but there were two that I was really drawn towards. First is the 1923 10/40 hp Mercedes sports two-seater. The model S, model SSK and 500K are the stars of this era of sporting Mercedes vehicles but I love its compact size and the pairing of saddle leather with white paint. This was the world’s first production car with a supercharged engine and while it only produces 40 hp, it looks like a ton of fun. This is what the SLK should be in spirit.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430372750654-P0XSKT61NTPKWAA4DZO7/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5541c18ce4b08b5a0e266e7f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1430372750654-P0XSKT61NTPKWAA4DZO7/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Early Mercedes-Benz racing cars were called “Silver Arrows” by the press and were immensely successful at their time. Auto Union (evolved into what we now know as Audi)&#160;was&#160;also grouped into the same family and had my favorite car, the Type C. Historically though, the Mercedes-Benz W 25 is the most significant and was the first model&#160;to be called&#160;a Silver Arrow. The W 25 was originally painted white but when it arrived at Nürburgring for its first race, it was a kilogram over the weight limit. To reduce its weight. the mechanics sanded away its paint, leaving the car bare aluminum. I think the W 25 is the most handsome of the Mercedes-Benz Silver Arrows, thanks to its simple form and prominent grill, which is almost Audi in shape. I've always loved the pairing of aluminum, fabric and leather but now that I know that&#160;this was done by accident and in panic, it's even more spectacular.</p>&#160;&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">More photos</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437280434829-B314YO6SZXVKVFD8BWQM/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab28b1e4b01127a12b47be\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437280434829-B314YO6SZXVKVFD8BWQM/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>Small House Big Door<br />중구 다동 115<br />★★☆☆<br />$</p><p>As I’ve said <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/seoul-mm-travel-guide-14\">before</a>, I adore Park Hyatt Seoul but it does come with a hefty tag. If you’re on a budget, Small House Big Door is an acceptable choice. I primarily hate staying at hotels because so many of them are designed with no taste. SHBD may not be as clean, comfortable, and sleek as I’d like but it does have a sense of design, which seems to be a rarity. The rooms are clinically unadorned and have fun little touches like 3D printed keys and lamps. The hotels is also excellent in terms of location, with a subway station at its doorstep and just a 5 minute walk to Myeong-dong. Even if you’re on a budget, your eyes don’t deserve to be terrorized by tacky hotel decor. Go to Small House Big Door.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437279428585-M69469N8M4QPNMX1V9AG/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab24c3e4b0ea19042ea9c1\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437279428585-M69469N8M4QPNMX1V9AG/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>Auprés<br />서초구 서초동 1451-86<br />★★★★<br />$$</p><p>Being in Seoul, I didn’t think my most memorable dining experience was going to be at a French restaurant, but it was. &#160;Auprés is a reasonably priced yet truly capable French restaurant with truly world-class dishes. The flavors are classic french, but with a light and fresh overtone. Everything was magnificent from the celeriac soup to the chicken stuffed with foie gras and mushrooms. Along with the stunning dishes, Auprés has a calm, soothing mood that makes it ideal for a date or a long dinner with a close friend. The mussel and paprika salad was a particularly notable dish and is a must-have if you visit.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437279185268-R3O9Y1C5UXASDWHDV930/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab23cfe4b0d9c287c918cb\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437279185268-R3O9Y1C5UXASDWHDV930/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>XII<br />용산구 이태원동 278-8<br />★★★☆<br />$$$</p><p>There are several locations of XII (or Bar 12) in Seoul. This one is notable because of its open layout that faces the street. Being summer, the windows were wide open, giving the bar a cafe-like mood. It’s a refreshing change from the dungeon-like bars you normally see. The drinks are decent too and crafted in a delicate manner, right in front of your seat. XII is worthy of praise but I don’t want small talk or loud music when I’m enjoying my drink - which XII unfortunately has plenty of. If you’re going to visit, it’s worth noting that the bar only has 12 seats though (get it?), which can make the place busy on weekends.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437279858995-LKT6FND4D60ROI56JKYQ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab2671e4b09b833bf0e46b\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437279858995-LKT6FND4D60ROI56JKYQ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>Ikovox<br />용산구 이태원동 118-71<br />★★★★<br />$$</p><p>This is one of the best coffee shops in Seoul and feels like something pulled straight out of Brooklyn. Thankfully, Ikovox isn’t just style and has substance - they roast their own beans (daily) and offer all of their drinks in any of their roasts. Espressos are pulled with expertise and lattes are rich and chocolatey when made with their Cello bean blend. Unfortunately, the barista I had at the Garosu-gil location was mediocre, so make sure you come out to Itaewon to experience Ikovox.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>Botton<br />용산구 이태원동 140-861<br />★★★☆<br />$$</p><p>This is another solid choice for coffee in Itaewon. Botton is not a roastery like Ikovox but this isn’t a big deal because they seem to source good beans. The iced americano I had was great and I also appreciate the fact that Botton has flat whites on their menu. The cafe has big windows that face a quiet street of Itaewon, providing a rare opportunity of peace in the crazy neighborhood. It’s a pleasant place to bring a book or a good friend and kill and hour or two.</p><p>EDIT: This location is now closed.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437280553760-1QEOVZE12C3FNHEIQ6UG/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437280579397-73Z3X6PS53WVTP50T36L/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab2942e4b059ab9fbb2ec1\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437280579397-73Z3X6PS53WVTP50T36L/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>만수네<br />용산구 이태원동 34-107<br />★★★★<br />$</p><p>Tteokbokki is a popular Korean dish that is often sold as street food, and is essentially rice cakes in a sweet and spicy chili sauce. I’ve been obsessed with this dish recently and have been looking for a restaurant that excels at it. 만수네 might be the best I’ve found on my recent visit. The tteokbokki is spicy without being inedible, and has enough sauce to dip tempura (which is the best part). What makes this place particularly great is their tempura, which is done in an unorthodox Japanese-style, making them extra crispy and delicate; it results in a tremendous texture when dipped in the chili sauce.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437348640035-O6PVT9WBWQO5BH60RRHU/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ac331ee4b07d0961f91326\" data-type=\"image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>Dongdaemun Design Plaza (DDP)<br />중구 을지로 281<br />★★☆☆<br />$</p><p>Philosophically, I’m on the opposite side of the spectrum from Zaha Hadid, but I must admit, the massive Dongdaemun Design Plaza is an impressive thing to see in person. The DDP features exhibition halls, historic artifacts, and shops but there isn’t necessarily much substance there, so visit primarily for the architecture like myself. Be sure to go at night when the entire structure is lit from the inside-out and the tacky plastic rose garden transforms into a sea of lights. The DDP has instantly become of Seoul’s most iconic landmarks so it’s worth a visit if you haven’t been. It really isn’t as tacky as you might think.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>마복림 떡볶이<br />중구 신당동 292-112<br />★★☆☆<br />$</p><p>When talking about tteokbokki, 마복림 떡볶이 is a name that comes up often. It’s located in Shindang-dong tteokbokki town - an&#160;entire street dedicated to tteokbokki. I found it to have more hype than substance though. The food wasn't nearly as spicy enough, and doesn’t contain nearly enough rice cake. I love the efficient service though - payment is taken as you order. Regardless of their fame, I’d skip this one.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437287836301-0GGBMCUC9EIM6VBS36R8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab459ae4b04a7449c11be4\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437287836301-0GGBMCUC9EIM6VBS36R8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>Common Ground<br />광진구 자양동 17-1<br />★☆☆☆<br />$$</p><p>Conceptually, Common Ground is interesting. It’s built completely out of blue shipping containers and is filled with pop-up shops. The shopping center is surrounded by food trucks and has a nice diversity of restaurants and cafes on the rooftop too. Despite all this effort, I found Common Ground’s selection of shops dismal, and was bored very quickly. It also doesn't help that the place is designed like a maze and is a pain in the ass to get around in. It’s amazing how they’ve made an interesting idea so uninteresting. If you go, just expect to see a lot of tacky graphic tees and cheap Samsung Galaxy cases.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437288042206-4B0GY8WWXCNJYJ39HFKC/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab4669e4b037ce0ae1b9e4\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437288042206-4B0GY8WWXCNJYJ39HFKC/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>Alegria Coffee Roasters&#160;<br />광진구 자양동 17-1<br />★★★☆<br />$$</p><p>When you’re at Common Ground and annoyed by the curation of shops, head over to Algeria Coffee Roasters on the rooftop. They roast their own beans, have a solid menu, and the baristas seem to know what they’re doing. They also showcase new roasts on a seasonal basis, which is fun for the regular. There’s a pretty good cold brew on the menu too, which isn’t super common in Seoul yet. The seating is uncomfortable but you should honestly just enjoy the coffee and move on to a more interesting neighborhood.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437288263543-Q2KW8LD1KP829HDURKKO/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab4746e4b037ce0ae1bb6f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437288263543-Q2KW8LD1KP829HDURKKO/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>김선생<br />강남구 신사동 652<br />★★★★<br />$</p><p>“Fast casual” dinning seems to be a global phenomenon, and 김선생 is a perfect example of this formula done right. 김선생 specializes in gimbap (Korean makizushi), and focuses on the basics: a clean, streamlined experience, a focus on quality ingredients, and a low price-tag. And yes, the restaurant achieves all of these. I love how ordering is done on a touchscreen but the food is brought to your table by a server. It makes the dining experience streamlined but not too dystopian. The food is of course the highlight of 김선생, with gimbap rolled to order using quality ingredients you normally don’t see at this price point or category. My favorite on the menu is actually their cheapest gimbap, the 바른 김밥, which just contains a generous amount of vegetables and eggs.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\"        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437288579531-SLPP2KJWRMP6GKI2Q4FB/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab4882e4b09b50dbbbd0da\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437288579531-SLPP2KJWRMP6GKI2Q4FB/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>Mikkeller<br />강남구 신사동 544-22<br />★★☆☆<br />$$$</p><p>Mikkeller is a microbrewery from Copenhagen that’s well known for its unique collaborations. The Seoul location was launched recently and offers an impressive selection of beers on tap. First impressions were nice, with a playful interior sprinkled with fantastic illustrations Mikkeller is so well known for. I tried three different beers here and unfortunately didn’t enjoy any of them, as I found them too complex and fruity. That being said, I’m not a big fan of beer to begin with, so if you like beer, Mikkeller might be a different experience for you. I really did think the atmosphere really was spectacular though. I just wished it was a whiskey bar.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437288871412-DD4YZVU1FKA78VMH0JDL/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab49a6e4b0687d3677aa7f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437288871412-DD4YZVU1FKA78VMH0JDL/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>준’s 888<br />은평구 서오릉로 195<br />★★★★<br />$</p><p>Every country has their interpretation of cheap Chinese food, and if you’re looking to taste the Korean interpretation of the cuisine, this is the best I’ve found in the city. I’ve been to countless Chinese restaurants in Korea but none come close to 준’s 888. The tiny restaurant run by just two (the chef, and his wife) and although it can look off-putting visually, it’s one of my favorite restaurants in the world. The place can be a bit of a trek from central Seoul, it’s totally worth the trip. Both pillars of Korean Chinese cuisine, jajangmyeon and jjamppong (particularly good when you add abalone here) are amazingly executed here, as is the sweet and sour pork. You know that a restaurant has go to be good when pretty much every Chinese restaurant in the city offers delivery and you don’t. As a matter of fact, 준’s 888 doesn’t even allow take-outs. Badass.&#160;</p><p>EDIT: Due to health problems, 준’s 888 has closed and has been replaced with a more simple dumpling restaurant. I have not yet visited.</p>&#160;&#160;<hr />\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ab4c89e4b0a996cf33a73a\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1437289611306-R4XKF64AT80I0K6HPRY9/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>동빙고<br />용산구 이촌동 301-162<br />★★★☆<br />$$</p><p>Bingsu is a Korean shaved ice dessert and is essential to surviving the humid Korean summers. 동빙고 is one of the Big Three’s of bingsu in the city, along with 옥루몽 and Mealtop (my favorite). 동빙고’s approach is about perfecting the basics. They only use Korean red beans and keep the recipe pure, using just ice, milk, condensed milk, and rice cakes, along with the mandatory red bean topping. The simple approach is effective, and there was a huge line when I visited. Thankfully, they offer take-out, complete with an insulating sleeve. Their bingsu was good, but I still prefer Mealtop, whom I’d give ★★★★, thanks to their richer, milk-based ice that's shaved smoother.</p>&#160;&#160;&#160;","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Tue, 21 Jul 2015 06:59:08 H8</a><br />$499 USD<br />Denmark<br /> </p>&#160;<p>Considering how ubiquitous Bluetooth is today, it’s surprisingly hard to find a pair of Bluetooth headphones that are actually worth buying. I don’t think I’m asking for too much; I just want a pair that is compact, sounds good and doesn't look like shit. As a fan of BeoPlay <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/bo-beoplay-h6-review\">H6</a> headphones, I was immediately intrigued by the new H8s.&#160;I’ve been using them daily for a month now, and I think I’ve finally found the headphones I've been looking for.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439570933090-1ED4W9QDYEWBSFCOAQB1/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kNHdQa-cO5cV_GNWZBIIX2sUqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKctCYWQf02wf8Tt064TYQiHNGG9Xc6kVepDrEUMf_p3Zm0eDuYk2wPglryzuqnQBEq/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x830\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ce1bf4e4b03e8de40f396d\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439570933090-1ED4W9QDYEWBSFCOAQB1/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kNHdQa-cO5cV_GNWZBIIX2sUqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKctCYWQf02wf8Tt064TYQiHNGG9Xc6kVepDrEUMf_p3Zm0eDuYk2wPglryzuqnQBEq/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The H8s come in a similar box to all other Beoplay products. I like the matte texture and sharp edges but wish it was a bit more subtle, when considering B&#38;O’s premium image.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439669593540-Q1W442BC5NMSPEGSG7P1/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55cf9d57e4b02774e51f3865\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439669593540-Q1W442BC5NMSPEGSG7P1/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The unboxing experience is pleasant. The accessories and manuals are housed in compartments that make a clean first impression. In terms of accessories, the headphones come packed with a carrying pouch, audio cable, micro USB cable (for charging)&#160;and flight adapter.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439957711735-HZNHDZ6GBIC80Z4PC7FU/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d402cee4b05cbbf5e942e8\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439957711735-HZNHDZ6GBIC80Z4PC7FU/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Like the H6s, the headphones come with a floppy pouch for transport. I really wish B&#38;O would put more effort into something more substantial and protective.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439570805476-Z2QMGS1SDD7JV71CI29Z/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ce1b72e4b0bd94754ef33e\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439570805476-Z2QMGS1SDD7JV71CI29Z/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Being a B&#38;O product, attractive design is a necessity. The H8s are no exception and are probably the best looking bluetooth headphones on the market today. The headphones are available in two color ways:&#160;a gaudy beige/gold and a more sophisticated brown/grey. It's worth noting early on that the H8s cost $499, which makes them the most expensive product in the category by a considerable margin.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958424318-2WRJZ761TH7Y70CFULPK/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40597e4b0d6007406e0d9\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958424318-2WRJZ761TH7Y70CFULPK/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>B&#38;O has made some truly iconic products in the past and set a pretty high bar, which I don’t think the new BeoPlay products have been able to match. The H8 is relatively well-made and aesthetically pleasing but it doesn’t have the purity or sophisticated quality of some of their legacy products. The irrational shapes are what bother me the most, like the shape of the plastic housing that sits under the spun aluminum caps.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439957831392-TQH6CY04JJE8KMI2OPGJ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40343e4b0d06bf5f7a3fb\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439957831392-TQH6CY04JJE8KMI2OPGJ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The arms of the H8s are made from aluminum and anodized in a dark grey color that looks much better than the silver finish on the H6s. I wish B&#38;O would have finished the parts in finer finishes though, as both the brushed and bead blasted finishes come off as a bit crude.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439957893694-2TSJNKOPPBIZ538CN8QS/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40382e4b0d06bf5f7a4f7\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439957893694-2TSJNKOPPBIZ538CN8QS/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439957865827-8VI7IJTG13IKMEND5KI7/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40365e4b0d06bf5f7a481\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439957865827-8VI7IJTG13IKMEND5KI7/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>What I find exceptional is the amount of movement the hinges provide. The design has one of the best ratio of low visual complexity vs freedom of movement I’ve seen on any headphones.&#160;The headphone cups rotate completely flat too, which makes them easy to transport. I prefer headphones that fold flat like the B&#38;Os because a flat object makes more sense to me when packing; everything else in my backpack like my laptop and notebook are flat as well.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958151593-02J397ZG1IXZ2T29PC79/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40486e4b00fab3a954197\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958151593-02J397ZG1IXZ2T29PC79/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The H8 has a on-ear design which as you may know, has both positive and negative characteristics. I rarely use headphones at home so travel is my biggest reason for purchasing these. Being on-ear headphones, the H8s are significantly more compact that the BeoPlay H6s and takes up little space in your luggage.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958094760-UGZQYDVLZAAT5OCWPRZS/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d4044de4b00fab3a9540ee\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958094760-UGZQYDVLZAAT5OCWPRZS/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The biggest negative with headphones that sit on the ears is always comfort. They create more compressive force by nature, and the H8s are no exception. I’ve made two trips to Seoul with these now, which involves 11 hour one-way flights from Seattle. From my experience, the H8s are fairly comfortable considering their on-ear design. It’s only after 4-5 hours that you begin to experience any fatigue, which I resolve by slightly adjusting the position of the headphones. Because the comfort of on-ear headphones depends highly on your head size and ear geometry, you should really try these out in person before making such a big purchase. The H6s were comfortable for pretty much everyone, but this one is admittedly a bit more varied.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958346511-FFSDCI111ITHW4WF10FX/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40549e4b0a051fa5ee2a8\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958346511-FFSDCI111ITHW4WF10FX/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The ear pads are made of soft lambskin and create a tight seal around the ear. They’re backed with very soft memory foam and do a good job of reducing most of the headband pressure. I’ve had bad experiences with many on-ear headphones and I think the well cushioned ear pads are what make these tolerable. They’re also fairly lightweight considering the heavy use of metal and leather. At 255g, they’re just a bit heavier than something like the Beats Solo 2 Wireless.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958229520-KSVZTX9G71QJ79BC7F5M/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d404d1e4b07a4744d1f42c\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958229520-KSVZTX9G71QJ79BC7F5M/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The earcups are finished with spin-brushed aluminum cups. And unlike the H6s, the finish is really fine and relatively free of rainbowing. The really cool thing here is that the right cup is actually a touch sensitive panel that enables gesture controls. You can play/pause music, answer calls, switch Active Noise Cancellation on and off, and more. B&#38;O has made the gestures really logical (ie: a circular gesture lowers/raises the volume) so the learning curves is low.&#160;The really amazing thing here is that they have embedded touch into an aluminum surface - it’s notoriously difficult to achieve and something I’ve never before seen on a production product.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958385945-HMQ63G6CKOQHPTUT18S3/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40570e4b08af97db1d83e\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958385945-HMQ63G6CKOQHPTUT18S3/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The primary reason why I purchased the H8s is of course because of Bluetooth. The H8 has Bluetooth 4.0 and AptX, a technology that enhances sound quality (but is not available on all devices, including iPhones). I’ve found Bluetooth performance to be strong and because the H8 uses Bluetooth 4.0, pairing happens automatically - although it can take a moment or two before pairing. I did notice a few Bluetooth hiccups in daily use - mostly while walking around urban environments. I’ve had no issues while sitting at my desk, in a plane or at a cafe though.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439571063833-14V2SACH6CI5GE0P7TO8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ce1c73e4b07fb58fa1b2cc\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439571063833-14V2SACH6CI5GE0P7TO8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Now for the really important part - sound. As soon as I started listening to the H8s, I immediately knew that they have a completely different character from the H6s. While I really liked the way the H6s sounded, I wished it had a punchier sound akin to products from Bowers &#38; Wilkins. With the new on-ear design, the H8s are able to produce a tighter seal and now able to deliver much more powerful bass. It makes the sound profile much more energetic, sculpted and compatible with more bass heavy genres like pop or hip-hop. The deep bass is paired with a warm midrange and clear treble - good for casual/extended listening but still full of detail. The on-ear design does narrow the soundstage in comparison to the H6 but I don't find it overly claustrophobic.&#160;In terms of wired vs wireless acoustic performance, the headphones seem to handle both really well. The H8 does sound a bit more dull and warm in bluetooth but it’s a largely trivial difference unless you’re doing side-by-side comparisons.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958534729-0XWJ9VY7F0SJXLSKF21N/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40602e4b0a051fa5ee543\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958534729-0XWJ9VY7F0SJXLSKF21N/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>One of the most important features of the H8 is active noise cancellation. I never fully understood the need for noise cancellation, probably because I had never owned a pair of headphones with the feature before. Noise cancelation is now a must have for focusing at work and transatlantic flights, and the H8 does a splendid job at it. Nearly all unwanted noises are removed with it enabled, which provides complete peace during long flights. I don’t have any experience with Bose products but the H8s don’t leave much more to be desired.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958553285-TGOWW270D5ZO35V2LHP1/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40617e4b0a051fa5ee595\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958553285-TGOWW270D5ZO35V2LHP1/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Battery life is pretty good too, with 35 hours of noise cancellation in wired mode and 16 hours in bluetooth mode. The battery is removable too so you can purchase extras if you are a frequent traveller, or buy a replacement when in need of one.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958581302-NKQABXGZCD8BM1MZDQTM/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55d40633e4b0a051fa5ee66b\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1439958581302-NKQABXGZCD8BM1MZDQTM/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p>Final score<br />★★★★</p><p> </p>&#160;<p>The BeoPlay H8s are truly as good as they get in this segment. Yes, they do cost a bit more than their competitors but they’re built using quality materials, and look far better than anything else in the market. They also sound spectacular with a great balance of clarity and deep bass, making them super versatile. I was expecting the H8s to be good but I didn’t think they’d be this great. Sometimes you simply get what you pay for.</p>&#160;&#160;&#160;","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2015 04:31:21
