    sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600584622-0FWA88NBSBWS6WVNQOKT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kFn01b69qibFV6p4ATINgYx7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmaHJ0CCIp0h94CjFWATtzumDyWwG6cTlYaiji1mbxg2_decyTpAb-46CnvkjVgn6l/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adafbe4b0cf570102ebe8\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600584622-0FWA88NBSBWS6WVNQOKT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kFn01b69qibFV6p4ATINgYx7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmaHJ0CCIp0h94CjFWATtzumDyWwG6cTlYaiji1mbxg2_decyTpAb-46CnvkjVgn6l/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><strong>Ikepod Megapode Date</strong><br />$2500-3500 USD (APPROX)<br />Switzerland</p><p>Founded in 1994, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.ikepod.com\">Ikepod</a> is a Swiss watchmaker founded by Oliver Ike (an entrepreneur) and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.marc-newson.com/Default.aspx\">Marc Newson</a> (a designer that needs no further introduction). The name of the brand is a combination of Ike’s last name and earlier work by Newson called the <em>Pod Watch</em> (1986) and <em>Pod Clock </em>(1989). This explains the conceptual similarities between Ikepod's lineup and the Pod timepieces. The history of Ikepod is a complex one full of difficulties. In 2003, Ikepod went bankrupt and was later taken over by a New York art dealer, Adam Lidemann. At this point, the company started producing more exclusive pieces at higher prices and lower quantities. Although some of my favorite pieces were produced in this resurrected period, the company still had issues and Newson eventually left in 2012. Ikepod is still operating as a company but there haven’t been any new products or developments since then.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600612267-SP2TIJ7SUPT81TK9EAN5/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kFn01b69qibFV6p4ATINgYx7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmaHJ0CCIp0h94CjFWATtzumDyWwG6cTlYaiji1mbxg2_decyTpAb-46CnvkjVgn6l/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adb19e4b0cf570102ecdf\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600612267-SP2TIJ7SUPT81TK9EAN5/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kFn01b69qibFV6p4ATINgYx7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmaHJ0CCIp0h94CjFWATtzumDyWwG6cTlYaiji1mbxg2_decyTpAb-46CnvkjVgn6l/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Although some of Newson’s work is questionable, there is no doubt that he is one of the most interesting and ingenious designers of the modern era. When it comes to form in particular, he is exceptional and has been making some truly enduring work in the past decade. The Ikepod watches are of this nature – they’ve been timeless thus far and I suspect they’ll stay this way. If there’s any product that I can call my favorite piece of design, this is it.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600663581-80FJIMETS2WBLUADR38U/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kFn01b69qibFV6p4ATINgYx7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmaHJ0CCIp0h94CjFWATtzumDyWwG6cTlYaiji1mbxg2_decyTpAb-46CnvkjVgn6l/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adb51e4b0cbb57689b234\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600663581-80FJIMETS2WBLUADR38U/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kFn01b69qibFV6p4ATINgYx7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmaHJ0CCIp0h94CjFWATtzumDyWwG6cTlYaiji1mbxg2_decyTpAb-46CnvkjVgn6l/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>There are two Ikepod models that remain as the most iconic – the <em>Hemipode</em> and <em>Megapode</em>. Both watches were produced in a large range of styles, with the Hemipode dual-time chronograph being the favorite amongst fans. It too is my personal favorite and has been my dream watch for as long as I can remember. I found it hard to justify spending so much on a watch so I recently purchased a more affordable model, the Megapode Date. The standard Megapode is the better known variation but also more complicated. It features time, date, chronograph, as well as a slide rule which I think leaves the dial looking a bit too complex. The Megapode Date is a far simpler 3-hand watch with a date window.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444622463105-ZYX3L273K527L6XGOJCT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561b307de4b07ac6acf7cf0b\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444622463105-ZYX3L273K527L6XGOJCT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The Megapode Date was manufactured from 2002 to 2003. It’s worth emphasizing this because I find it incredible how modern the watch looks despite it being 13 years old. It’s not just progressive for something a decade old -&#160;it still looks forward thinking and futuristic today. The watch is water resistant to a depth of 50 meters and has a movement based on the ETA 2824-2. It is one of ETA’s most popular movements and while it isn’t prestigious or exotic, it has made its name as a workhorse. It’s used by countless brands, from Longines to IWC. &#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600731855-HK0SQXUA7UDNSRB2AY2K/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adb98e4b0cbb57689b436\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600731855-HK0SQXUA7UDNSRB2AY2K/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>In terms of design, what defines the Megapode is the monocoque stainless steel case. It joins the sapphire crystal in a continuous way, creating a pure and fluid surface.&#160;This clean form is further enhanced by having only one part line next to the bezel. The watch is assembled entirely from the front,&#160;which is unusual and does create complications for servicing. It's a price worth paying for its pure form though.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600755541-YEBICT8A2P0OVEIMBIG2/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adbb0e4b0cbb57689b4e7\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600755541-YEBICT8A2P0OVEIMBIG2/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>By making the watch disassemble via a single part line on the bezel, you’re left with a gorgeous, uninterrupted back. The back is easily my favorite view of the product.&#160;The voluminous form is complimented by an elegantly off-center window looking into the movement. There’s some nice detailing in the movement to marvel at too, particularly on the oscillating weight (engraved with a typically Newson pattern). Ikepod produced 9999 units in each dial version (was available in seven colors) with every casing numbered on the back. As you can see, this one is 0521/9999.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600695578-TMHNZIZROOJWG57GZ595/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adb75e4b0cbb57689b32c\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600695578-TMHNZIZROOJWG57GZ595/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>As far as I know, the Megapode is the biggest watch Ikepod has produced. At 47mm, it’s massive, but not crazy by today’s standards. Back in 2002 though, 47mm was considered to be more of a ridiculous size, and the Megapode was one of the first watches to start the normalization of large watches. Something to keep in mind though is that the Megapode has such a rounded form that the watch doesn’t look or feel like its size. On the wrist, you'd believe that it's just 44mm.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600714343-DBUWY34ZCGPU4T4MWFN6/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adb87e4b0cbb57689b384\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600714343-DBUWY34ZCGPU4T4MWFN6/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The icon (mascot?) of the brand is the button quail;&#160;a small, flightless bird that is remarkably unremarkable. It’s a member of the <em>hemipode</em> family of birds which brings a bit of sense to the watch with the same unusual name. This bird-based naming convention is continued by the <em>megapode</em>, which is a stocky chicken-like bird. In older Ikepod models, the quail is only present on the crown, but post 2003, the bird took a more important role and became a part of the logo, which was engraved directly on the crystal. You can always tell apart these later models by this little detail.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444618676688-SP7QQXRBR1JI1EIEC8SL/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561b21afe4b0d3fe4c948003\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444618676688-SP7QQXRBR1JI1EIEC8SL/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The Megapode Date came in seven different dial colors, with the grey one being my choice (model name MGD05). The grey dial is matte,&#160;complimenting the brushed stainless steel and it also pairs well with the orange second hand. The design of the dial is very clean with delicate markings and a slightly embossed logo which adds a nice detail.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444601015329-CGBI6D1BJLG70PLUK0HD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adcb5e4b0cf570102f637\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444601015329-CGBI6D1BJLG70PLUK0HD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The sapphire crystal is super thick, and extends about 4.5mm above the casing. The thickness really gives the sapphire a rich look, and I just love the way light falls off the crystal and meets the body. The crystal comes with an antireflective coating from the factory which I’ve found to scratch pretty easily. I suppose AR coatings weren't as advanced in 2002. After seeing a few scratches on the coating, I ended up just polishing it off to the sapphire.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444602984859-ZJUKWTYSTGOM249FMA8A/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561ae467e4b0c93c7c04daab\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444602984859-ZJUKWTYSTGOM249FMA8A/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I have been wearing the Apple Watch daily and while its impact on my life is questionable, it has definitely gotten me more interested in horology.&#160;The Apple Watch wet my appetite for watches with its pseudo Ikepod looks and made me wonder - why don't I just get the real thing?</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444602995406-VC9DQQR2A1AKPAUUSYLQ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561ae472e4b0c93c7c04daec\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444602995406-VC9DQQR2A1AKPAUUSYLQ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Ikepod watches are best known for their “pod-like” form but the signature strap design is just as iconic. It’s an uninterrupted rubber strap that is free of clasps, using an ingenious pin-and-tuck closure system. I think this strap is one of the most creative designs conceived by Marc Newson, and it’s always a pleasure to see a new strap design because it's a rarity in the watch world.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444603007195-3H9DDGH9QL5WJJWCCTVP/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561ae47de4b0c93c7c04db4f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444603007195-3H9DDGH9QL5WJJWCCTVP/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444603023067-DBVK2TJMPEQ8SHAMETOB/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561ae48ee4b0c93c7c04dbce\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444603023067-DBVK2TJMPEQ8SHAMETOB/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>While Ikepod wasn’t able to popularize their strap design, Marc Newson’s involvement at Apple has been able to bring it to the masses in a scale nobody could have imagined. The similarities between the Ikepod and Apple Watch bands are uncanny. It's fun to compare them and all you can conclude is that the Apple Watch bands are more comfortable, better made, and also more attractive than the original. It seems like all the lessons learned through the original design was applied to Apple's modern iteration. Practice makes perfect.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444603035624-7YTWEH8T99QHOWAKN13X/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561ae49ae4b0c93c7c04dc11\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444603035624-7YTWEH8T99QHOWAKN13X/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>An interesting trait of the rubber Ikepod straps is that they’re vanilla scented. My straps are over a decade old but they still smell pretty strongly of an overly chemical,&#160;obnoxious vanilla scent. I don’t enjoy the smell but find it at least conceptually intriguing.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600772067-Y4X3Z38HFJXTQ502C4LR/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adbbfe4b0cbb57689b543\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600772067-Y4X3Z38HFJXTQ502C4LR/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The sculptural form of the Megapode is truly embraced when put on the wrist. Most watches can be seen as a two-dimensional object: a face that sits on a wrist. But the Megapode is an enjoyable object from all views, thanks to the fluid form that removes distinction between the front and back. The form is also ideal for comfort as it minimizes contact with your wrist. Paired with the rubber straps, the watch is surprisingly comfortable despite being so large.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444621548146-25LGBDEA6OGP46DDPS9S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561b2cebe4b0c93c7c06919f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444621548146-25LGBDEA6OGP46DDPS9S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>One of my favorite things about the Megapode is the lugless design. I think they're unsightly and crude, unless if they’re on a classic example.&#160;The way the Megapode's straps simply pierce the monocoque case is so fresh and modern. They're attached using tiny screws on both sides of the strap, hiding nearly all signs of mechanical attachment.&#160;This really reinvents the traditional watch form; it creates a bold aesthetic and brings harmony unseen in traditional watches. Sure, people say that you shouldn’t reinvent the wheel but nobody said anything about modernizing it.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600932532-IEFXDQ6OL9GJ96THJIKW/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"561adc63e4b0a6f765f06e50\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600932532-IEFXDQ6OL9GJ96THJIKW/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><span>Final score</span><br /><span>★★★★</span></p><p>Ever since I started studying design, I remember being mesmerized by Ikepods. The sleek, futuristic design looked extraordinary and unlike anything else I had seen before. I’m sure that them being unobtainable also had something to do with my fascination for them. To keep the watches exclusive, Ikepod restricted the list of dealers, which made them even harder to come by. Before acquiring my own, I had never even seen one in person. Now that I finally have one, I can really come to appreciate the beauty and nuances of it as an object. It is truly a magnificent thing and so well thought out, from the sculptural form to the immensely clever straps. Once you begin wearing a mechanical watch, you also notice a certain poetry to the art of timekeeping. There's a level of craftsmanship and engineering elegance that cannot be matched by digital devices. Thanks Apple, for making me fall in love with watches. &#160;</p>&#160;&#160;&#160;","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 12 Oct 2015 04:40:49 +0000","feedId":6606,"bgimg":"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600584622-0FWA88NBSBWS6WVNQOKT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kFn01b69qibFV6p4ATINgYx7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmaHJ0CCIp0h94CjFWATtzumDyWwG6cTlYaiji1mbxg2_decyTpAb-46CnvkjVgn6l/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w","linkMd5":"77799134dd7cb45a521685d09e6ae98b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn2@2020_3/2020/08/25/15-32-36-218_7bc74538a5e60da2.webp","destWidth":1000,"destHeight":1500,"sourceBytes":328492,"destBytes":23316,"author":"Andrew aderx32/cdn90@2020_2/2020/08/25/15-32-40-387_a20def8f5c63af60.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444603035624-7YTWEH8T99QHOWAKN13X/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn38@2020_3/2020/08/25/15-32-41-292_db1854b7d260725f.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600772067-Y4X3Z38HFJXTQ502C4LR/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn50@2020_6/2020/08/25/15-32-53-400_d145bb132466eabf.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444621548146-25LGBDEA6OGP46DDPS9S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn54@2020_2/2020/08/25/15-32-53-564_43ef3a7aa5cdbf28.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1444600932532-IEFXDQ6OL9GJ96THJIKW/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn98@2020_3/2020/08/25/15-32-44-156_73d9a596fb63798f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598369555791},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","title":"Leica Q (Type 116)","link":"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/leica-q","description":"<figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675033901-5OWLK3DTR2V64O28RS9T/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee3716e4b05778ab07342f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675033901-5OWLK3DTR2V64O28RS9T/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://us.leica-camera.com/Photography/Leica-Q/LEICA-Q\">L</a><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://us.leica-camera.com/Photography/Leica-Q/LEICA-Q\">eica Q</a><br />$4250 USD<br />Germany</p><p>With the exponential development of camera technology, Leica inevitably felt lost and unable to stay relevant. For so long, they’ve invested purely in mechanical and optical perfection, rendering them archaic compared to more tech centric cameras. But things are changing in Wetzlar. They’ve become surprisingly innovative recently, having launched the beautiful Leica T, and an X camera that’s actually quite good. Then in June, Leica surprised everyone with a completely new camera - the Leica Q. It’s everything we dreamed Leica would make - a compact street camera with a fast auto focus lens, full-frame sensor, and built-in viewfinder. Best of all, the Q <em>costs only $4250</em>. It may seem like a lot compared to other brands but for a full-frame Leica with true substance, it’s a bargain.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675071967-UXPAPTM1Q8TMDR3B3PKH/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee373ce4b05778ab0734fd\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675071967-UXPAPTM1Q8TMDR3B3PKH/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The Q is a product with no compromises. It’s beautifully made but also immensely capable. For many people, owning an M is no longer a necessity, especially if auto focus is a priority. It’s no wonder that the Q has been so popular since launch. It’s been months since the camera became available but it’s still backordered everywhere, and being sold by resellers with insane mark-ups of up to 200%. I’ve been using the camera for a month now, but not my own. Two of my coworkers have received their cameras before me and have been nice enough to let me use them while I wait for mine. I have my name down on a few wait lists but to this day, my camera isn't in my hands.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675092697-T36ETKH68ELZH8PW106D/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee374ee4b05778ab073542\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675092697-T36ETKH68ELZH8PW106D/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Design is of course one of the biggest pillars of Leica. The Q is no exception and is without a doubt, and attractive piece of hardware. The problem is that the Q isn’t as pretty as the M and certainly not as good looking as the Leica T. The thing that I really don’t like is the grip material finished with a debossed diamond pattern. Thankfully,&#160;<a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.ebay.com/bhp/arte-di-mano\">Arte Di Mano</a> is already selling pre-cut replacement leather grips for the Q. I have one on order and can’t wait (the sad reality is that it'll probably arrive before my camera).</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675110313-WRB9BRGCKR8PS3650TL8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee3762e4b05778ab073598\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675110313-WRB9BRGCKR8PS3650TL8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>One of the aesthetic issues I have with the Q is that the camera comes only in black. I’m not against black cameras but I'm just personally not a fan of black Leicas because they do such a fantastic job of satin silver finishes. It's a constant reminder of the prettier finishes available.&#160;It also annoys me that the Q is made from aluminum and magnesium but doesn’t use it to its advantage. I wish Leica would have let the aluminum shine using a unibody construction like the T or just went with brass like the M so that we can get Leica’s signature finishes.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675186972-0WKS0128QJHLKRMD79Q5/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee37aee4b08530e82f3dc7\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675186972-0WKS0128QJHLKRMD79Q5/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Although the Q isn’t the most attractive Leica, it is very much a functional one. The camera is wonderful to handle and immediately fits the hand like a glove. It's relatively lightweight thanks to the extensive use of magnesium and is just thick enough to give you a firm grip. The back of the camera also has a little divot for your thumb, which obviates the need for an unsightly accessory grip.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675215176-TQNY5U8YTPFTADBPG49A/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee37c4e4b08530e82f3e2e\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675215176-TQNY5U8YTPFTADBPG49A/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Along with a well balanced feeling in your hand, the Q has very logical, intuitive controls. The camera has essentially the same control layout as the M, which is certainly a good thing. Most cameras require a few weeks to familiarize and develop muscle memory but the Q is immediately obvious. All the controls you’d want are there and there are none that you don’t. It’s a proper Leica.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675285534-57MBDZ2LJEN1O81OOTRE/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee3814e4b086d4d6a7b2e8\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675285534-57MBDZ2LJEN1O81OOTRE/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675352073-3FWZMW1OCIG87L9QKSAQ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica Q  —&#38;nbsp; f 1.7 —&#38;nbsp;ISO 100 —&#38;nbsp;Seoul, Korea\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee384fe4b0bf70212aeb70\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675352073-3FWZMW1OCIG87L9QKSAQ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q <span>—&#160;</span>f 1.7 —&#160;ISO 100 —&#160;Seoul, Korea</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>There’s probably one controversial aspect to the Q, and that’s the lens. The Q is not a camera with an interchangeable lens has a built-in 28mm f 1.7 ASPH lens (fixed focal length). This is obviously not the first choice for many people and honestly, a 35mm lens would have been more appropriate/popular. However, the 28mm glass is surprisingly useful. Distortion is minimal, making it ideal for cropping, and street photography. The lens is also astoundingly sharp, even wide open (you can seriously shoot exclusively at 1.7 if you wanted to) and renders images beautifully. It really does feel like an M lens - and it’s no wonder Leica claims it’s just as good. The lens also comes with a lens hood similar to the M's Summarit 35mm - which is one of the more attractive ones.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica Q —&#38;nbsp;f 1.7 —&#38;nbsp;ISO 100 —&#38;nbsp;Bellevue, USA\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee387be4b0bf70212aec49\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675389349-98OXGNP5RNP8LA5M18I4/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 1.7 —&#160;ISO 100 —&#160;Bellevue, USA</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The Leica Q has a small button next to where you thumb sits that switches between crop modes. The camera has 35mm and 50mm crop modes, which I’ve found to be immensely useful. Rather than showing you a cropped image, the camera creates digital frame lines (like the M), which is great for composing shots. This seemingly simple feature may not seem revolutionary but there's something it that makes the lens <em>feel</em> more versatile and workable. &#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n data-image-id=\"55ee38abe4b0bf70212aed56\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675440683-8665W8G0K7N9OXYY5W1E/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 1.7 —&#160;ISO 125 —&#160;Seoul, Korea</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Some may not like the idea of cropping images but the camera’s files are large and so crisp that I have been doing it constantly. The crop modes are also useful for shooting things like products to minimize distortion. For those still doubting the usability of a 28mm lens; my <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/bo-beoplay-h8\">B&#38;O H8 review</a> was shot exclusively with the Q.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675510818-ITP250TIEYRBSUVANJJ6/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-id=\"55ee38eee4b03487a605968f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675510818-ITP250TIEYRBSUVANJJ6/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 1.7 —&#160;ISO 640 —&#160;Bellevue, USA</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Along with the lens, the sensor is what makes the Q so brilliant. It’s a full-frame 24MP CMOS sensor, and is paired perfectly with the lens. Colors are beautifully rendered, but at the same time well mannered - something I think Leica balances really well. Dynamic range is also really good, and staggering amounts of detail can be recovered in post. After living a happy year with the Leica T, I didn’t think I’d need a full-frame camera. Looking at the files from the Q makes me realize I was wrong though.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675552017-AA8AZJQE8I9P416A07BA/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee391ae4b03487a6059760\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675552017-AA8AZJQE8I9P416A07BA/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>One of the great features of the Leica Q is the ability to switch into a macro mode. This is done using a macro ring, which also <em>physically</em> slides the hyperlocal distance meter into a dedicated macro distance meter. It’s marvelously engineered and so German.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n Taiwan</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I was a bit worried about the usability of a 28mm lens as a macro lens but it turns out to be quite capable. The macro mode has a minimum focus distance of 17cm and performance is fantastic. The autofocus works perfectly at this distance and the resulting images are sharp. Who knew that a fixed lens could be so versatile?</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 1.7 —&#160;ISO 100 —&#160;Seattle, USA</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The Q is compact and discrete, two things that make you want to use it every day. It fits easily into any backpack and doesn’t attract too much attention when you’re shooting with it. I’ve gotten many compliments and questions about my Leica T when shooting with it in public, which is both annoying and distracting. The camera also has a nearly silent mechanical leaf shutter which makes it good for shooting on the street.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 1.8 —&#160;ISO 100 —&#160;Seoul, Korea</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I can’t shoot without a viewfinder, so when I learned that the Q had one built-in I was jumping with joy. It’s a good one too with a staggering 3.68MP resolution. The Leica T’s optional Visoflex was one of my favorite things about the camera and the Q’s seems to be just as good. The only issue I have is that the viewfinder can’t rotate, which is a feature I found immensely useful with the Visoflex.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica Q —&#38;nbsp;f 2.8 —&#38;nbsp;ISO 1250 —&#38;nbsp;Seoul, Korea\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee3aa8e4b05e517b50ee98\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441675949884-FL7YPBRY4RPKADCCJYIL/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 2.8 —&#160;ISO 1250 —&#160;Seoul, Korea</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>One of the advantages of using a Q over an M is autofocus. It’s really fast and reliable, and easily better than any of my pervious cameras (Leica T and Sony RX1). There’s even an iPhone-like touch-to-focus feature that works remarkably well, although I fail to imagine a scenario when it would be useful. For more tricky situations, the camera also supports a proper manual focus mode with focus peaking. Focusing is done using a very M-like focus lever, which feels buttery smooth.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica Q —&#38;nbsp;f 4.0 —&#38;nbsp;ISO 100 —&#38;nbsp;Hsinchu City, Taiwan\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee6234e4b025d99f737887\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441686071288-MQ4CUJ96B8WA36MVB0ZR/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/20150804-L1020288.jpg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 4.0 —&#160;ISO 100 —&#160;Hsinchu City, Taiwan</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The images from the Q have a really nice color palette, although I found them to be too punchy after being accustomed to the Leica T. I’ve said this before, but I personally don’t like shooting RAW, as I want to spend as little effort post processing as possible. The T wasn’t 100% reliable for me, so I ended up shooting mostly in RAW but the reverse is true for the Q. The sensor is so consistently good at rendering images that I keep the camera in JPEG mode with a few tweaks to the on-camera JPEG settings. If you’re wondering, here are the settings:</p><p><strong>Contrast</strong> Low<br /><strong>Saturation</strong> Low<br /><strong>Sharpness</strong> Medium high</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 2.0 —&#160;ISO 1000 —&#160;Seoul, Korea</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>After spending a few weeks with the camera, I’m convinced that one of my favorite features of the Q is the ability to select crop modes between 28, 35 and 50mm fields of view. This may sounds like a frivolous feature and something you can do in Lightroom but it completely changes the way you shoot with the camera. There’s something that changes in your brain when you switch between these “digital lenses” making you really shoot as if you had just switched lenses physically. It’s a revelation.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n Taiwan</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>And of course, you are paying with resolution when cropping images but as long as you don’t shoot too much in 50mm crop mode, things shouldn’t be an issue, even for print. Here’s a chart of the image sizes relative to the different field of view modes:</p><p><strong>28mm</strong> 6000 x 4000 px<br /><strong>35mm</strong> 4800 x 3200 px<br /><strong>50mm</strong> 3360 x 2240 px</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n USA</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Leica’s aren’t known for low light performance but the Q is pretty decent. From my experience, as long as you don’t go over ISO 6400, you’re guaranteed to have clean images.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 1.7 —&#160;ISO 100 —&#160;Bellevue, USA</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica Q —&#38;nbsp;f 1.7 —&#38;nbsp;ISO 125 —&#38;nbsp;Seoul, Korea\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee50a8e4b0c1b8362995e8\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441681588827-OCOM1PGTK2LRSKJDNQ0A/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p>Leica Q —&#160;f 1.7 —&#160;ISO 125 —&#160;Seoul, Korea</p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I love a camera with good white balance and the Q does well here as well. There were a few instances in indoor situations where the camera got a little confused but for the large part, I’ve had no issues. This is something I hope a future firmware release could improve.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441676265786-B5GSK77KISEFS355C5Y8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"55ee3be4e4b0fe005b3c0a13\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1441676265786-B5GSK77KISEFS355C5Y8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><span>Final score</span><br /><span>★★★★</span></p><p>If you’re in the market for a new camera and have 4K to spend, this is where your money should go. The Q does everything right. It’s beautifully made like all Leicas, but is super capable and functional in a way that many Leicas haven’t been able to deliver. This is a camera that is the best of both worlds, which isn't a common thing. It’s a sports car that can also seat 5 and get great gas mileage. Every time I pick up the Q, I'm amazed that it's a product that was even able to come out of Leica. It really does makes me question the fate of the M in its current form.</p><p>A camera is a complex object that requires months of use for a proper evalution. Like I have with the T, I’ll post an extended review in a few months time. But for now, I’ll just say this: put your name down on a wait list ASAP. I guess it's too late now but you don't want to be waiting as long as I have.</p>&#160;&#160;","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Sep 2015 03:35:21 />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433124076349-0E6CCKDDDX2WQFRVXHU8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"556bbceae4b03e593d07a1ba\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433124076349-0E6CCKDDDX2WQFRVXHU8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.kohezi.com/collections/paul-loebach\">Kikkerland Ora Teapot / Teacups</a><br />$45 / 30<br />USA<br />★★★★</p><p>Surprisingly clever and simple in design, the Ora teapot and teacups are affordable, well made and a pleasure to use. The humble looking Ora teapot comes with<span>&#160;a&#160;(overly trendy)&#160;cork lid&#160;and</span>&#160;a wire coil strainer in the box that works surprisingly well (I’ve used it with green and oolong tea)<span>.</span>&#160;The company also makes matching tea cups that come in a set of two. Both the teapot and cups have a double-walled design that keep&#160;heat way from the outer walls,&#160;eliminating&#160;the need for a handle. This&#160;also helps insulate the tea inside, making it a truly functional design. I really like the simple, primitive aesthetic achieved via the usage of double walls and appreciate the utilitarian nature of the objects.&#160;It's an unpretentious, functional product that you'll want to use everyday.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">*</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">Special thanks to <a href=\"http://www.kohezi.com\">Kohezi</a></p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"556bb909e4b01c7319e0c827\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433123084416-3TX07UPGKUXIHBNNQ4YT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.aesop.com/usa/fragrance/marrakech-intense/marrakech-intense-eau-de-toilette.html\">Aēsop Marrakech Intense Eau de Toilette</a><br />$79<br />Australia<br />★★★★</p><p>As you may know, I’m a huge fan of Aēsop’s products for their beautiful aroma and design. This is their first venture into creating a fragrance;&#160;the unisex Marrakech Intense. They had an earlier second iteration of the same scent, but the original lacked staying power so the intensity was cranked up – hence the name “<span>Marrakech Intense</span>”. In terms of aroma, Marrakech is woody, spicy, with a touch of floral. It's a smooth and natural smell that's also sophisticated. Distinctively&#160;Aēsop is the best way to describe it.&#160;I’ve received many compliments for wearing this, and I agree with Aēsop, the Marrakech is inoffensive and&#160;neutral, making it a&#160;good choice regardless of gender.&#160;</p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"556bbb08e4b061b67a03b047\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433123593355-JFHYQJVAULIZ76T025PR/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a href=\"https://www.penchalet.com/fine_pens/ballpoint_pens/lamy_pico_ballpoint_pen.html\">Lamy Pico</a><br />$45<br />Germany<br />★★<span>☆</span>☆</p><p>The Lamy Pico makes a good everyday pen. Using a spring-loaded mechanism, it collapses into a compact size, not much bigger than a lip balm. When expanded though, it's almost&#160;as big as a regular pen making it comfortable to write with. Some may find the Pico a&#160;bit thick for extended writing though. The pen uses Lamy's&#160;M22 ballpoint refill, which is one of the smoother ballpoint tips I’ve used. The outer shell&#160;is largely made from brass but doesn’t feel as premium as it should, due to the largely plastic interior construction. Overall, the Pico is a fine pen with an appealing design. You <em>will</em> get tired of people asking why you have a tampon on your desk though.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">*</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">Special thanks to <a href=\"https://www.penchalet.com\">Pen Chalet</a></p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433123351436-HBQNW66YVVQCTIFELNE4/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"556bba16e4b09c5199c06ed0\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433123351436-HBQNW66YVVQCTIFELNE4/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a href=\"http://store.apple.com/us/buy-watch/apple-watch\">Apple Watch (42mm, Stainless Steel)</a><br />$599 – 1099<br />USA<br />★★★☆</p><p>There have been many smart watches predating the Apple Watch, but this is the first one worthy of being called a “watch”. It’s built with the precision and craftsmanship comparable to products an order of magnitude more expensive. It's a true expression of what Apple's best at - great hardware. The Apple Watch is made from sapphire, stainless steel, and ceramic, all of which really make it a beautiful object to behold. If you're in the market for one, I'd recommend the stainless steel watch; the aluminum sport model is a disappointment, with an unappealing finish that comes off feeling a bit&#160;cheap and unrefined.&#160;Where the Apple Watch becomes more difficult to judge is in its functionality. Just like the first generation iPhone and iPads, it's too early to make any concrete conclusions about its validity as a product.&#160;If you live in an Apple ecosystem though, I think you’ll largely enjoy having the Watch on your wrist. It’s not something I’d call a must-buy just yet, but if you get one out of curiosity, you won’t be disappointed. Personally, having notifications, alerts and fitness tracking on my wrist is enough of a reason&#160;for me to charge this thing every night. It’s easy to be skeptical and negative about the Apple Watch but once you use it, you won't want to take it off. It&#160;grows on you. Slowly, but it will.</p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\"
