/>\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433124357355-N4RV4RWNS4OP8EXM0HYX/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"556bbe04e4b0fc3b5d4bbb86\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433124357355-N4RV4RWNS4OP8EXM0HYX/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a href=\"http://store.apple.com/us/product/MJ5J2/42mm-link-bracelet\">Apple Watch Link Bracelet</a><br />$449<br />USA<br />★★★★</p><p>Constructed almost exclusively from machined stainless steel parts, the Link Bracelet is easily the most impressive band available for Apple Watch. There two big&#160;innovations here: the links can be removed without a tool and the butterfly clasp is the thinnest I’ve ever seen. It’s beautiful, precise and a bargain at $449 when considering the number of machined components it's made of. Like other&#160;stainless steel watch bands, you'll end up scratching this one up during regular use.&#160;It's not a big deal though,&#160;as stainless steel is an easy material to refinish.</p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a href=\"http://store.apple.com/us/buy-watch/apple-watch?product=MJ3Y2LL/A&#38;step=detail\">Apple Watch Milanese Loop</a><br />$149<br />USA<br />★★★☆</p><p>I’ve always liked Milanese straps for their comfort and the Apple Watch’s is no exception. The Milanese Loop is made from woven stainless steel coils, forming a fabric-like mesh. The strap&#160;closes <span>impressively</span>&#160;using a magnet, which makes it infinitely adjustable. I like the comfort this one offers but am a bit conflicted about it’s almost retro design. This is a good option if you want a comfortable yet premium option but don't like the leather straps that are available like myself.&#160;</p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"556bc178e4b0c3683a9e2342\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433125241402-ZKXDEROYYWAXZDU0FQ9S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://store.apple.com/us/product/MJ4Q2/42mm-black-sport-band\">Apple Watch Sport Band</a><br />$49<br />USA<br />★★★☆</p><p>The Sport Band on the Apple Watch is made from fluoroelastomer, which is a dense, durable material that is also very pliable, making it immensely comfortable. Marc Newson’s influence is clearly shown here:&#160;the Sport Band has nearly identical in&#160;design as the beautiful <a href=\"http://www.ablogtowatch.com/some-ikepod-watches-hands-on/\">Ikepod Hemipode</a>’s strap. I’ve tried every Apple Watch band and the Sport Band is possibly&#160;the most comfortable for me. Many people just talk about how expensive the Apple Watch is, but this is an example of how Apple is bringing truly luxurious craftsmanship to the masses. If this had a Swiss watchmaker’s logo on it, it would have been several hundred dollars more expensive. The only problem I have is that most of the colors are unappealing and far too vibrant for my tastes. I had originally purchased a white band but didn't like the color&#160;in person (it's too bright) so I ended up swapping it with a black one.</p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a href=\"http://www.gordyscamerastraps.com/neck-horiz/index.htm\">Gordy’s Camera Strap</a><br />$27<br />USA<br />★★★☆</p><p>Finding a simple leather strap can be a surprisingly hard task. A friend of mine discovered Gordy’s at our local Leica Store so I picked one up for my Leica T (I'm using a <a href=\"http://www.matchtechnical.com/Pages/TStrapLugKit.aspx\">T Strap Lug Kit</a> from Match Technical). Gordy's strap has a dead simple construction&#160;and is devoid of any adjustability or padding, which is just the way I like it.&#160;While it isn’t exactly made with a high level of precision, you can’t go wrong with its amazingly low price.</p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433125368607-LD7OJ9TKDD03C4IK5VRD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a href=\"https://mykita.com/en/sunglasses#layer:/en/sunglasses/decades-sun/mercer/matte-grey-brilliantgrey-solid-cat3\">Mykita Mercer</a><br />$450<br />Germany<br />★★☆☆</p><p>I needed new glasses last month&#160;so I decided to go with the Mercer by one of my favorite brands, Mykita. If you haven’t heard of them, they are an eyewear manufacturer based in Berlin that makes exclusively handmade frames. I’ve always like them due to their clever construction and manufacturing methods. The Mercer uses Mykita’s skrewless hinge, which&#160;uses interlocking stainless steel components to form a hinge. It’s a clever design that is not only more durable than traditional hinges but also feels like a Mercedes’ door to close; it’s German after all. I’m happy with the Mercer but I can’t help but feel like these eyewear brands still need to charge us less.</p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"20150531-L1002023.jpg\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"556bfc8de4b0a6971d65630b\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1433140369077-X2PAI1K0U6FCN5UWAXJ5/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/20150531-L1002023.jpg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a href=\"http://www.camper.com/en_US/men/shoes/mortimer/camper-mortimer-18955-001\">Camper Mortimer</a><br />$195<br />Spain<br />★★★★</p><p>Camper always manages to make awesome stuff and I fell in love with the Mortimer at first sight when I was in Milan last month. The Mortimer is the manifestation of what Camper is all about – an element of surprise. You may only notice the beautifully matte pigskin at first glance but upon closer inspection, you’ll see details like the angular rubber outsole and the unique molded forms. It’s a smart and modern take on a familiar type of shoe.&#160;</p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n recently purchased these refillable pump bottles from Muji so that I didn’t have to look at ugly hand soap packaging. It pumps well, and looks better than anything on the shelves of Safeway but I wonder if I’ve gone insane by buying a PET bottle for $4.5.&#160;</p><hr />&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\"><a href=\"http://www.mi.com/en/mipowerbank10400/\">Mi Power Bank 10400mAh&#160;</a><br />$14<br />China<br />★★★☆</p><p>The fact that Xiaomi is able to produce something so well made for just $14 is precisely why we should keep a close eye on&#160;them. The finish of the aluminum on the Power Bank is pretty damn nice and simply amazing when you consider how cheap this product is. It's certainly better than any aluminum finish you'd find on a Samsung product. The model I went with has a capacity of 10400mAh,&#160;which holds enough juice to charge an iPhone several times. I took mine to Europe and it only needed to be recharged every other day, even with my friend recharging his phone with it. />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Portland (Oregon) and Seattle are my most frequently requested cities for a MM Travel Guide so I put one together for Portland during my trip there last week. I’ll get to a Seattle travel guide eventually as well. Enjoy.</p>&#160;<hr /><p class=\"text-align-center\">★☆☆☆<br />Avoid, a waste of time.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">★★☆☆<br />Good, but mediocre.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★☆<br />Great.&#160;Worth a visit.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★★<br />Exceptional. A spiritual experience.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\"> </p><p class=\"text-align-center\"><strong>$</strong><br />Affordable</p><p class=\"text-align-center\"><strong>$$</strong><br />Reasonable</p><p class=\"text-align-center\"><strong>$$$</strong><br />Pricey</p>&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Sunset Audi</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424756061172-RY4BE6H5AEUD8KDY4BVK/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec0d5ae4b0b896afa7518e\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424756061172-RY4BE6H5AEUD8KDY4BVK/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★★<br />Beaverton<br />$$</p><p>When I was driving down to Portland from Seattle, a bolt flew off of a truck and hit my Audi’s radiator, making it leak coolant. Thankfully we weren’t too far from Portland and decided to push forward to the city’s largest Audi dealership, Sunset Audi, topping off the coolant whenever it bottomed out. They were extremely hospitable, getting me in a loaner quickly and finishing the repair by early next morning. The dealership noticed that a new protective grille was available in front of the radiator and installed that as well. It was annoying that this happened but was solved painlessly thanks to Sunset’s professionalism.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Ace Hotel Portland</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424757013689-4XWFNWTHFRAY73GR684V/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec1114e4b0a0f14fa295d9\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424757013689-4XWFNWTHFRAY73GR684V/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★<span>☆</span>☆☆<br />Downtown<br />$$</p><p>After hearing so much about Ace Hotel, I expect much more from them. It’s amazing what can be considered as “charming” these days. In terms of location, Ace Hotel Portland is phenomenal. It’s right in the heart of downtown and walking distance to the Pearl District. Unfortunately, I found it to feel more like a worn down college dorm room than a trend leading hotel. The poorly painted rooms show dozens of layers of paint, and everything from the air conditioner to the shower knobs look distressed, not gracefully aged. Tiny rooms, creaking floors, weak showers and lack of parking only add to the disappointment and are too much to compensate for the few charming touches like the nice bathrobes and cute keys.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Pok Pok</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"20150217-L1000017.jpg\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec0f78e4b0165bdd00b59e\" data-type=\"image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424756528364-GW52JD1M9Y7FSV8KWDFW/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec0f2ee4b05bee3a0bd85c\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424756528364-GW52JD1M9Y7FSV8KWDFW/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★★<br /><span>Richmond</span><br />$</p><p>Pok Pok is a thai restaurant focused on street style food done with creative freedom. Last year, the New York location notably received a Michelin star. The Vietnamese fish sauce wings are their signature dish and I can assure you, they are out of control. I’m not much of a chicken person and rarely order it at a restaurant but they're totally mouth watering here. Another notable dish was the charcoal grilled eggplant salad that was topped with a surprising combination of Thai chillies, fish sauce, palm sugar, boiled egg, dry shrimp, and prawns. Everything I’ve had here was fantastic, including the water, which is infused with pandanus leaf (has a nutty flavor). Keep in mind that the dishes are best enjoyed family style and be sure to follow your server’s advice as the menu can get overwhelming in terms of choice. The decor is a bit erratic and maybe overly quirky but tends to work because of its cleanliness. Pok Pok has quickly become one of my favorite restaurants ever, and is a must visit when in Portland.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">DOC</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\"        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424762384317-ZTIPFDGH69TKQT058N1S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec260ce4b0c9a277f592ef\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424762384317-ZTIPFDGH69TKQT058N1S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★<span>☆</span><br /><span>Concordia</span><br />$$</p><p>DOC is an intimate and charming Italian restaurant with weekly menus. The tasting menu is the best way to experience the restaurant and is shockingly cheap at just $60 per person for a 6 course meal. The tiny kitchen is located at the entrance of the restaurant, giving the restaurant a welcoming, informal mood. My first visit to DOC was absolutely brilliant with every dish absolutely spot on, but this visit, some of the dishes failed to impress, with some of the dishes being surprisingly poorly seasoned. I suppose that’s the asterisk I need to put on my recommendation as experimentation seems to have resulted in a bit of inconsistency for the food here. Regardless of this though, DOC gets so many things right like their humble atmosphere, good wine, perfect pacing, and most importantly, spirit of experimentation.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Voodoo Doughnut</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424760361665-R2B58AH9S95FQMS4BIIJ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec1e25e4b0a4a2247eaaf9\" data-type=\"image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★<span>☆</span>☆☆<br /><span>Chinatown</span><br />$</p><p>I don’t get it. This place has so much hype that you’d think they actually had good doughnuts. After waiting in a long line, you’re rewarded with a remarkably average doughnut with either an outrageous topping or a poorly executed decoration. There is absolutely nothing I find redeeming about this place. Save this one for the tourists. No thank you.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Salt &#38; Straw</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424760312357-ZYFQSLPLQWSIR3I8SXSA/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec1df4e4b0a4a2247eaa6a\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424760312357-ZYFQSLPLQWSIR3I8SXSA/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424759551107-534TD0AV6ORP9RMMVSX4/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec1afce4b01dbc251ca798\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424759551107-534TD0AV6ORP9RMMVSX4/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★★<br />Richmond<br />$</p><p>Salt &#38; Straw is a chain of ice-cream shops based out of Portland that’s doing everything right. Like any reputable ice-cream shop, they make their own waffle cones, which makes the whole place smell delightful when you enter. Their ice-cream is creamy, velvety and has a strong milk flavor which will make you craving for more. My personal pick is always sea salt with caramel ribbons but Salt &#38; Straw is also known for their crazy seasonal flavors like mincemeat pie. What makes this place particularly great is their dedication to quality. For instance, the caramel they use is made in-house and their honey lavender ice-cream is made by using Oregon-grown lavender petals steeped in local honey. They’ll make you ice-cream all over again.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Multnomah Whiskey Library</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424759195095-X35JQPWABAAJMA3JC8BW/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec1998e4b032bc083adf69\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424759195095-X35JQPWABAAJMA3JC8BW/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★★<br />Downtown<br />$$</p><p>A bar known for their multi-hour long waits, Multnomah Whiskey Library is best enjoyed on a quiet weekday. The place feels classy from the moment you enter, and has a mood that perfectly demonstrates what a whiskey bar should be like. The bar is dominated by massive library-esque shelves that hold 1500 whiskeys, showing off that they have the most extensive whiskey list in town. When sitting in a booth, a bartender dressed neatly in a vest comes to your table with a cart to make your cocktail in front of you. This isn’t just for entertainment though, as the drinks were top notch, with thoughtful attention to details like the perfectly clear oversized ice cubes and the leather coasters. If you love whiskey and a good old-fashioned, visiting this place is necessary.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Stumptown</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424760841588-XKSM5X3OXHJN0GXEY7TI/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec2003e4b08f2aaf41501f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424760841588-XKSM5X3OXHJN0GXEY7TI/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★<span>★</span><span>★</span>☆<br />Downtown<br />$$</p><p>Stumptown has locations sprinkled across the US but are headquartered in Portland. They’re regarded as one of the best roasters in the country and have a cold brew that is straight up amazing. In terms of execution, this shop at Ace Hotel is neatly done and located conveniently while shopping in downtown. Stumptown coffee is always good but I had to knock a star off for lack of consistency at this particular location and absolutely disgusting croissants (I warn you, just get coffee here).</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Quin</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★<span>★</span><span>☆</span>☆<br />Downtown<br />$$$</p><p>In theory, Quin should be a four star establishment. They make hand crafted candy from high quality, local ingredients, all wrapped in a modern, clean package. Unfortunately, their candies just don’t taste that special. Sure, they’re good, but I don’t think their worth $16 for a pack of 20 caramels good. These guys either need to up their game in terms of flavor and execution or dramatically reduce their pricing.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Canoe</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424761189936-OD2QD2AEJ3L481C0ZI55/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec2162e4b035a09dab25c2\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424761189936-OD2QD2AEJ3L481C0ZI55/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★<span>★★★<br />Downtown</span><br />$$</p><p>Canoe is probably my single favorite store in Portland. They curate design objects from glassware to watches and do a beautiful job of it. There’s interesting objects from brands like Iittala, Snow Peak, Braun and I find myself buying something every time I visit. Something I really enjoy about Canoe is how they have a card for each product telling its story. A product without a story is like a car without history, and Canoe seems to get this. These kinds of design oriented stores are a rarity in most American cities and ones that curate good products even more rare. Canoe is one of those rare gems and it’s unfortunate none like it exist in Seattle. I’ve found the staff to be friendly as well and they always give you a bag of Haribo gummy-bears when you make a purchase.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Aēsop</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\"        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424761499358-S7K4TVWS20VBEOI297JD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec2298e4b0a3ebc2cdcf97\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424761499358-S7K4TVWS20VBEOI297JD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★<span>★</span><br /><span>Downtown</span><br />$$$</p><p>Aēsop is an Australian company specializing in skin care products with a particularly big emphasis on design. I’m a huge fan of the brand, not only because they do a superb job on&#160;design but also because they make fantastic products. They primarily use plant-based ingredients, smell great, but also work really well. Every proper city has an Aēsop store and this one is a pretty good one. A wash basin stands in the center of the store where you can test out their soap products and end with a sampling of their lotions. Staffed with friendly employees, they help you find products you like and sell the brand’s friendly image spectacularly. Little touches like the way they spray their perfume on the shopping bag really demonstrates Aēsop’s masterful ability to sell a retail experience.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Snow Peak</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec2447e4b0328389b6f324\" data-type=\"image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★<span>☆<br />Pearl District</span><br />$$</p><p>This is the only retail location of the Japanese camping brand, Snow Peak in North America. I’ve always liked their honest, craftsmanship driven approach, so it was a delight to find this store in Portland. The selection here is pretty comprehensive from camping gear to apparel. The store isn’t particularly attractive but the products themselves make it worth the visit. This is the brand that pretty much invented the modern glamour of camping - if you like the Japanese approach to design, you’ll like Snow Peak.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Steven Alan</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54ec27f2e4b0a4a2247ec719\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424762869948-Y1NQG9UXVF96JN8IY5D0/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★<span>★<br />Downtown</span><br />$$</p><p>Located across the street from Ace Hotel, Steven Alan is where I usually end up spending the most amount of money in Portland. They primarily carry Steven Alan but also carry some of my favorite brands like Acne and Norse Projects. The design of the store is a bit underwhelming but the great curation and helpful staff totally make up for it. If you can’t find anything to buy here, there’s something wrong with you.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Table Of Contents</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★<span>☆</span>☆<br />Chinatown<br />$$$</p><p>Located in Chinatown, Table of Contents is a tiny store that carries a variety of products from apparel to objects. Desirable brands like Comme des Garçons and Issey Miyake dominate the store but I’ve found the selection to be a bit too thin. It’s worth a visit for some of the quirky curation that happens here - there was a Jack Nicholson book this time that was pretty great.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"thumb-image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★<span>☆</span>☆<br />Downtown<br />$$</p><p>Nike is headquartered pretty close to Portland so I was hoping that this downtown location would be something special. Unfortunately, it’s not all that special and falls short of it’s New York counterpart in both retail design and selection. This one is in need of a redesign. Portland’s sales tax-free shopping experience is the one thing that saves this place.</p>&#160;&#160;<h2 class=\"text-align-center\">Powell's Books</h2>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p class=\"text-align-center\">★★<span>★</span>☆<br /><span>Pearl District</span><br />$</p><p>Powell’s Books is headquartered in the Pearl District and is called Powell's City of Books. It’s supposedly the largest independent bookstore in the world, which in itself makes it an attractive tourist’s attraction. It’s always a fun visit and a place where you can easily spend an hour browsing through random books. The sheer number of used books is truly impressive and finding a bargain purchase is inevitable. Like most book stores though, the selection of design books isn’t all that great, which is something everyone can learn from Tsutaya mages.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424763503292-O7NSU7WRKXRO0YN75FOB/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn86@2020_6/2020/08/25/15-32-53-035_1c3d5e37b1e00d1a.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1424763527600-7RAIV5OJY4H9YMXQNZ37/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn5@2020_1/2020/08/25/15-32-54-300_f95eab7f0dc9aa03.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598369555796},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","title":"Nocs NS2 Air Monitors V2","link":"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/nocs-ns2-air-monitors-v2","description":"<figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54710094e4b0b4e83191c2dc\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416691860585-MNYUIAM3ZMP7F3VJDXZT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>If you’re a longtime reader, you’ve probably heard of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://nocs.se/\">Nocs</a>&#160;already. They were one of the first supporters of this site and have sent their earphones in the past for&#160;review. They turned out to be truly well made and I’ve had many readers email me about how happy they were with their purchases. Like Minimally Minimal, Nocs has now grown over the years and recently launched their second iteration of their speaker system called the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://nocs.se/products/ns2-air-monitors-v2\">NS2 Air Monitors V2</a>. This is what I think:</p>&#160;<hr /><p class=\"text-align-center\">DISCLAIMER<br />The NS2 Air Monitors V2 have been sent by Nocs.</p>&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416691895464-01VB19CNBYJPIO2FS52W/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"547100b7e4b0b4e83191c356\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416691895464-01VB19CNBYJPIO2FS52W/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Nocs is a company conceived out of Sweden and in typical Swedish fashion, the design of the speakers are understated and democratic. I would fault them for maybe being too <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.supernormal.co.uk\">\"super normal\"</a>&#160;and lacking a bit of ambition but I’ll take that over the ornate, over promising stuff this market always presents.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894079257-3F7TCUZLF480V34TKJ1I/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5474167fe4b03905fd238063\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894079257-3F7TCUZLF480V34TKJ1I/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Many people compare the these to Audioengine’s products but I see them as very different products. I would personally never own an Audioengine speaker because of their heavy handed sensibility and lazy execution. I don’t like the strange surfacing on the front and the awkward intersection of&#160;the corners. While Nocs follows a similar layout, the execution is far superior with a rationality to the layout and form.&#160;Little things like the radii on a product are clear giveaways to understanding the amount of care a product has received and the Nocs does these little things better than most. This is ordinary done properly.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894026210-T5C8LI9CSCRKNSUZ1ZD9/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5474164ae4b0f73bdba168b0\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894026210-T5C8LI9CSCRKNSUZ1ZD9/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The NS2 V2 come in seven colors, ranging from white to orange. It’s an impressively large lineup and makes me wonder how they’re able to manage so many SKUs. Nocs knows me too well and sent me my favorite of the bunch - the grey model.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894004863-NJSUDLN5URS0POURW4ZB/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54741634e4b0f73bdba1684e\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894004863-NJSUDLN5URS0POURW4ZB/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The speakers have a soft, matte texture achieved through the use of soft-touch paint. I’m usually against soft-touch as it wears easily but these are meant to be stationary so my objection doesn't apply here.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894410364-FY9ZYBMAOHF7QFCOX5W8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"547417cae4b05ec99295cfe7\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894410364-FY9ZYBMAOHF7QFCOX5W8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I’m probably not alone in saying that I’ve come to dislike bluetooth because of its poor audio quality and spotty connectivity. The NS2 V2 support bluetooth but also have AirPlay, Apple’s wi-fi based streaming protocol. It has the benefit of being compression free and is also (theoretically)&#160;more stable than a bluetooth connection. At $400, the NS2 V2 are average in terms of price compared to other AirPlay speakers.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894579999-VRUD764KAWSXW39D6I5R/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/20141122-L1022544.jpg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"20141122-L1022544.jpg\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54741873e4b058281ff7bf01\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894579999-VRUD764KAWSXW39D6I5R/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/20141122-L1022544.jpg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I’ve tried two AirPlay speakers in the past, the Sony SA-NS500 and the Harman Kardon Aura. Both of those had unbelievably unreliable AirPlay implementations that would lose connection constantly.&#160;I’m happy to report that the NS2 V2 has the best implementation of AirPlay I’ve experienced thus far and has worked flawlessly for the past two weeks. The speakers connect instantly with all of my iOS and OS X devices and continue to stream music for hours with no hiccups.&#160;It’s weird that I have to say this but the NS2 V2 just works, and that sets it apart from a bunch of its competitors.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894557340-JI8RG9UAKKQL54WFVTS2/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5474185de4b058281ff7bed0\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894557340-JI8RG9UAKKQL54WFVTS2/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The out of box experience of&#160;AirPlay is still a bit of a convoluted process but Nocs provides an app that makes it a relatively simple process. Thankfully it’s something you only have to do once and it worked for me the first time. The speakers also support <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.spotify.com/us/connect/\">Spotify Connect</a>, allowing the speakers to stream directly from Spotify. I don’t use the service so I haven’t tried it out myself.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894326330-BAW5UWFHM9B5J2F0X1NM/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54741776e4b0d261adf1bef1\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894326330-BAW5UWFHM9B5J2F0X1NM/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The (rather messy) back of the right channel speaker is home to all of the buttons and ports. A standard AUX jack is available for versatility.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894181777-U5VIIA9X9A45A2UEGUJE/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/20141122-L1022516.jpg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"20141122-L1022516.jpg\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"547416e5e4b03a6d71643026\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894181777-U5VIIA9X9A45A2UEGUJE/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/20141122-L1022516.jpg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>In terms of cabling, you’ll have to live with two; an AC cable and a speaker cable connecting&#160;to the left unit. Nocs includes two speaker cables of different lengths, which is convenient.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894230838-4KFI2FM4XH8HIRJ196GR/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54741716e4b0d261adf1bd85\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894230838-4KFI2FM4XH8HIRJ196GR/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The AC adapter is unsurprisingly ugly and something just off the shelf. It’s an area where even larger companies like Bowers &#38; Wilkins sadly don't put any investment into though.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894464516-HQSPXVGSMQGK4XHCPER2/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54741800e4b081cfb2facf79\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894464516-HQSPXVGSMQGK4XHCPER2/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Sound is what Nocs has ways done well and the NS2 V2 are no exception. Both speakers have a 3” kevlar woofer along with a 3/4” silk tweeter producing 80W at peak power. They’re balanced to be punchy rather than flat, making them well suited to modern, more electronic driven music. That’s not to say that they’re overly bass heavy or lack treble detail though. Nocs continues to find a nice balance of detail and dynamism, providing a sound profile that's clear but not overly technical for everyday use. It's on the warm side, making them ideal for comfortable listening rather than critical -&#160;a characteristic that most people probably&#160;want out of their speakers.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894255927-D7TO9PUSHXN9KBDL8FOK/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5474172fe4b0d261adf1bdd4\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894255927-D7TO9PUSHXN9KBDL8FOK/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>My workhorse stereo&#160;speakers are the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/bowers-wilkins-mm-1\">Bowers &#38; Wilkins MM-1</a> and compared to them, the NS2 V2 do seem to trail behind in terms of audio quality. It’s only when you listen to them side by side that you see the short comings but it does make you realize what an engineering feat the MM-1s really are. Both the clarity and subtly of treble and the snappiness of bass are things that MM-1 simply does better.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894306896-V4R4WFPZABFSDPUZYP8C/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54741762e4b0d261adf1beb1\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894306896-V4R4WFPZABFSDPUZYP8C/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>However, it is worth considering that the Bowers &#38; Wilkins MM-1 are a $100 more and don’t have any wireless capabilities. It’s hard to call a simple winner here and your choice will really depend on whether connectivity or audio quality matters more to you.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894285862-LA3CSTO8574RERCXPH49/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5474174de4b0d261adf1be60\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894285862-LA3CSTO8574RERCXPH49/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The MM-1 and NS2 V2 also have further distinctions. The MM-1 have&#160;a very limited sweet spot, making ideal for use with a computer at a desk. The NS2 V2 have a longer throw and sound best with a little bit of distance. If you want a wireless speaker system to put on a bookshelf for an apartment or studio space, the NS2 V2 are probably the way to go.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894503061-BM95RMMO450J6KF9PH7S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54741827e4b081cfb2facfe6\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894503061-BM95RMMO450J6KF9PH7S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Overall, Nocs has done a really good job with the NS2 V2. At $400, they undercut offerings from the usual suspect like Bowers &#38; Wilkins and B&#38;O and offer well rounded acoustics and bullet-proof AirPlay connectivity. In many ways, they are characteristically very similar to their Swedish relative, Volvo. It’s a product that undercuts their British and German rivals in price, offers solid performance, all wrapped in unpretentious, honest design. If you're the type of person that can appreciate the soft, composed voice of Volvo, you already understand the appeal of Nocs. Beats are for children, it's time for this industry to grow up.</p>&#160;&#160;&#160;","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Thu, 27 Nov 2014 20:15:36 +0000","feedId":6606,"bgimg":"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416691860585-MNYUIAM3ZMP7F3VJDXZT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w","linkMd5":"2d0db4f86a8237da9f168b8ca44ee599","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn6@2020_2/2020/08/25/15-32-36-216_c93b78c2437e6633.webp","destWidth":1000,"destHeight":1510,"sourceBytes":484772,"destBytes":24980,"author":"Andrew -U5VIIA9X9A45A2UEGUJE/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/20141122-L1022516.jpg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn78@2020_3/2020/08/25/15-32-46-622_292b395a00e1f65c.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894230838-4KFI2FM4XH8HIRJ196GR/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn5@2020_2/2020/08/25/15-32-52-225_5c38c1b2e10f72c5.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894464516-HQSPXVGSMQGK4XHCPER2/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn54@2020_4/2020/08/25/15-32-41-451_a746a1a6053c57a0.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894255927-D7TO9PUSHXN9KBDL8FOK/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn22@2020_4/2020/08/25/15-32-43-582_47995fd4e69f2c11.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894306896-V4R4WFPZABFSDPUZYP8C/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn62@2020_4/2020/08/25/15-32-53-384_88259241ad7d0a47.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894285862-LA3CSTO8574RERCXPH49/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn6@2020_5/2020/08/25/15-32-41-782_f88a747942888c7f.webp","https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1416894503061-BM95RMMO450J6KF9PH7S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn61@2020_3/2020/08/25/15-32-50-544_73cf69db21c3cac5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598369555796},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","title":"MM Select | Winter 2016","link":"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/mm-select-winter-2016","description":"<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.nikka.com/eng/products/blended/fromthebarrel.html\">Nikka From The Barrel</a><br />$50<br />Japan<br />★★★★</p><p><span>&#160;</span>Nikka is a Japanese distillery founded in 1934, making it one of the oldest in the country. Like Suntory, they’ve been proving that the Japanese are capable of making some of, if not the greatest whiskeys in the world. From The Barrel comes in a beautiful, humble looking bottle that’s reminiscent of Muji packaging. The matte silver cap and the light grey paper used for the label are sophisticated without looking overly derivative like other whiskey packaging. The content itself is a blend of malt and grain whiskeys that is then re-casked, which allows the flavors to meld together more harmoniously. Despite the soft aesthetic of the packaging, the content is pretty strong (51.4%), and best enjoyed after allowing to sit for a while. Once its initial alcohol has worn off, you are left with floral, fruitiness and peppery spiciness. Oakiness takes a back seat but is still present along with notes of orange and toffee. Despite being bold and solid, there is plenty of depth here as well, and its nuanced notes and sweetness make this one your palette will enjoy exploring. I prefer drinking it neat or on the rocks and after a few sips, it quickly became one of my favorites in the collection. Unfortunately, Nikka From The Barrel is currently unavailable in the US so you may have to order it online or drive up to Canada like I did.<span>&#160;</span></p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1452148199282-GN27QASX47NS71W906LF/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"568e05d569492e195465d39a\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1452148199282-GN27QASX47NS71W906LF/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"568e06c50e4c1157fa0d1230\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1452148426034-8T6INE2XXQ2GCPDAM338/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1452148455048-1I1GJX9YEWS668TSOJN0/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"568e06df0e4c1157fa0d12d3\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1452148455048-1I1GJX9YEWS668TSOJN0/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>B&#38;O Beolit 15<br />$599<br /><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.beoplay.com/products/beolit15\">Denmark</a><br />★★★★</p><p>It’s winter, which means you’re probably staying indoors more than any other time of year. It also means that you’re probably listening to more music, which is why I began looking for a truly exceptional bluetooth speaker. I’ve used many but none are more memorable than the B&#38;O Beolit 15. It has thunderous, sculpted bass but maintains a clear, vital sound, making it a treat to listen to. The speaker isn't meant for critical listening but its rich and intense sound profile is likely what most people prefer for everyday listening. It’s also capable of reaching impressively high volumes and projects sound broadly, making it suitable for communal areas like the living room. The picnic basket-like design makes the speaker reasonably portable and its built-in rechargeable battery lasts 24 hours. There’s an effective leather strap for carrying the speaker, which has an attractive, natural color. At the rear of the speaker is a USB port which lets you charge your phone while listening to music. While charging, you can place your phone at the top of the speaker, which is dished and rubberized. I always thought the Beolit 15 looked a bit odd but B&#38;O recently added a “Natural” color scheme which really helps the speaker’s design. Other color schemes have the aluminum grill anodized in a range of colors but the Natural model’s is silver, which harmonizes well with the light grey body. The new color is what got me to finally try it out, and the sound is what made me fall in love.&#160;</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"568e07280e4c1157fa0d14c2\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1452148522949-8D3UWYUBB7HQRTPAY3A6/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://store.y-3.com/us/y3store/backpack_cod45267312nt.html\">Y-3 Day Backpack</a><br />$330<br />Germany<br />★★★☆</p><p>I’ve been looking for a decently large backpack and stumbled upon the Y-3 Day Backpack. I'm not usually a fan of Y-3's products but was immediately intrigued by the bag's sculpted, capsule-like shape and clean lines. The majority of the bag is made from neoprene, which has satin finish reminiscent of scuba gear. I love the way it looks but durability is probably a concern for those looking for something more rugged - neoprene is a material that ages, not patinas. The backpack has a large main compartment with plenty of internal pockets. There's also a dedicated pocket large enough for a 15\" Macbook Pro and a smaller one for an iPad or notebook. My favorite detail is the hidden pocket located beneath a flap of neoprene. It's attractively resolved and the zipper cut-out has an attractive pill-shaped cutout. There's also a bold elastic that wraps around the bag and ties the design together. It doesn't really have any functionality but is attractive enough to justify its existence. Other than a few questionable design decisions (like the leather patch on the top and the straps) though, the Day Backpack is pretty damn spot on, and functional too, thanks to its usable size, plentiful pockets, and comfortable, wide straps.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\"
