Mediocre.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">★★☆☆<br>Good, but nothing exceptional.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★☆<br>Great.&#160;Worth purchasing.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\">★★★★<br>Exceptional. A spectacular product.</p><hr /><p id=\"yui_3_17_2_1_1415220949538_16326\" class=\"text-align-center\"><br></p><p class=\"text-align-center\">NOTE<br>The prices displayed are approximately what you should be paying.<br>Make sure you do a bit of digging on the internet to find the lowest price.</p><p class=\"text-align-center\"><br></p><p class=\"text-align-center\">DISCLAIMER<br>Some of these products have been sent by their respective manufacturers.</p>&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415221245968-UHIQ50TZVAJLZ07JA02Y/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"545a8ffde4b06a5e574192b1\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415221245968-UHIQ50TZVAJLZ07JA02Y/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.coteetciel.com/en-US/lagoon-spa-pouches-m-vivid-monk\">Côte&#38;Ciel Lagoon Spa Pouch M</a><br />$100<br />★★★★</p><p>They’ve done it again. Côte&#38;Ciel is easily one of my favorite brands right now and they seem to have an endless source of interesting ideas. This is their interpretation of a dopp kit and features a detachable, TSA friendly clear pouch and a strap to hang it by the shower. In keeping with their architectural design language, the unique form of the Lagoon Spa Pouch is achieved through stitches in strategic locations of the neoprene. It’s beautifully made and everything from the material choice to the plump shape makes it something you want to fondle. This is personally my favorite object on this post and will make you want to go traveling as an excuse to use it.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415684102228-WDWOTIPHVNTD7W3YX1U3/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a006e4b0e58fabdb037b\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415684102228-WDWOTIPHVNTD7W3YX1U3/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.coteetciel.com/en-US/wallet-neoprene-cinder-grey-zipper-size-xs\">Côte&#38;Ciel Wallet XS</a><br />$30<br />★★☆☆</p><p>The Wallet XS isn’t a bad product but is simply to big for something with an “XS” nomenclature. I’m sure Côte&#38;Ciel intended this to be carried in a purse but there’s no functional benefit for a wallet to be 15% bigger than&#160;it should be. I’ve refused to admit its uncomfortable presence in my pocket and still use it everyday due to its gorgeous materials.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415684261623-Y4ZHCLQSESM50RJLK59W/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a0a5e4b054a6f86ac031\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415684261623-Y4ZHCLQSESM50RJLK59W/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.ammonyc.com/regimens/\">AMMO Regimens</a><br />$14-65 / bottle<br />★★★★</p><p>As any proper car lover will tell you, treating car paint and leather should be done with the same care and attention as skin. Proper cleaning, nourishment and protection is essential and nobody makes better products than AMMO. DRIVE teamed up Larry Kosilla from AMMO and did a series of videos on automotive detailing called <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL96D52AF54166C886\">DRIVE CLEAN</a>. I’ve learned a ton by watching the videos and built even more trust towards the AMMO's products. Yes, they’re a bit pricey but your car deserves the best.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415853255027-5XUNLB8I8JRWY2ENP6PD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"546434c7e4b0669ac2797514\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415853255027-5XUNLB8I8JRWY2ENP6PD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.michelinman.com/tire-selector/category/ultra-high-performance-sport/pilot-sport-a-s-3/tire-details\">Michelin Pilot Sport A/S 3</a><br />$200-400 / tire (approx.)<br />★★★★</p><p>Michelin came out with the Pilot Sport A/S 3 tires about a year ago and has redefined what a high performance all-season tire is capable of. During dry conditions, the tire is as responsive as the best high performance summer tires but also has remarkably good traction in wet conditions. This is thanks to a clever variable sipe design that expands and contracts to increase grip. Using sunflower oil, Michelin has also been able to lower the temperature in which the tires remain pliable, giving the tires class leading braking and cornering performance in winter conditions. This is the second time I’ve purchased the A/S 3s and I’m absolutely in love with them. I’ve even driven with them in <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://instagram.com/p/iKdkb1JOh5/\">heavy snowfall</a> last year on a Mercedes SLK without any issues. I thought a product with no compromises was an impossibility but Michelin has somehow achieved it.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685678998-QYWKM5Z4YVZZATP21SWP/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a62ee4b08fe952e4a255\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685678998-QYWKM5Z4YVZZATP21SWP/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://store.nike.com/us/en_us/pd/air-berwuda-mid-shoe/pid-843650/pgid-10255193?st=berwuda\">Nike Air Berwuda Mid</a><br />$65<br />★★★☆</p><p>Nike is all about developing a portfolio of innovative technologies and then applying them to a large range of their products. The Air Berwuda is a particularly good example as it uses techniques developed from the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/mm-select-summer-2014\">Roche line</a> and also uses <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://news.nike.com/news/hyperfuse\">Hyperfuse technology</a>. These are the most attractive shoes I’ve seen in a long time from the company and also provide plenty of comfort for everyday use. It’s Nike at its best.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685720307-42RW9G6QDAJ3V29UD8C6/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a658e4b03a44d11db61e\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685720307-42RW9G6QDAJ3V29UD8C6/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://store.nike.com/us/en_us/pd/air-max-lunar90-water-resistant-shoe/pid-1487271/pgid-1489054\">Nike Air Max Lunar 90 Water Resistant</a><br />$140<br />★★★☆</p><p>The Nike Air Max is like the Porsche 911 of the shoe world. They have a long history, countless variants and a diehard fan base. The Air Max Lunar 90 maintains the classic Air Max shape but updates it with the latest Nike technology like Lunarlon and Hyperfuse. They even make terrific winter shoes as they’re made from water-resistant nylon panels that are fused together. A classic shape, comfortable wear and utilitarian materials makes this one a really good buy.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415686640168-TCVAK1HIJ5E50KQ6XUZS/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a9f0e4b00403fddb87a4\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415686640168-TCVAK1HIJ5E50KQ6XUZS/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.aecraft.com\">Aecraft Flow and Slim Wallet</a><br />$123 / $49<br />★★☆☆</p><p>Aecraft is off to a good start but have some work to do before they can compete with the big dogs. The products are made from nice materials and are put together better than many of their competing startups. Despite some clever touches like the magnetic clasp on the MacBook sleeve, the designs feel dated and frankly mundane. Good, but nothing exceptional.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685838493-4PUSKLX50PB4OSX4VS80/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a6cee4b0e0996438b208\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685838493-4PUSKLX50PB4OSX4VS80/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.stelton.com/en/Category/Products/1310-10_Vandfilterkande_smoke.aspx\">Stelton Water Filter Jug (Smoke)</a><br />$50<br />★★★☆</p><p>Based on the iconic vacuum jug designed by Erik Magnussen, this water jug has the same iconic form and supports filter units from Brita, Mavea and Bosch. I’ve been looking for an attractive water jug that supports Mavea filters for a while now and this is as good as it gets. It has a nice, clean pour and the lid doesn’t fall off when pouring with water still in the upper cavity.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415686606453-OE6I3CWE8ARDG545WJGG/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a9cee4b02a78c5fdeb4f\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415686606453-OE6I3CWE8ARDG545WJGG/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://store.sony.com/portable-wi-fi-speaker-w-airplay--zid27-SANS500/cat-27-catid-EOL-Home-Theater-Accessories\">Sony SA-NS500</a><br />$300<br />★★☆☆</p><p>The Sony SA-NS500 is a bluetooth/AirPlay speaker with a built-in battery for portability. It’s currently discontinued so good deals can be found though I’m not convinced that it’ll be worth the effort. In theory, the SA-NS500 is the perfect casual speaker. It offers plenty of wireless connectivity, has a decent battery life and is acoustically optimized to project sound in 360 degrees. Unfortunately, the AirPlay connection is very unstable and the sound is far to bass heavy.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415686961937-D8ESGAUQMW89SXU94LKA/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461ab31e4b08f1a465e1feb\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415686961937-D8ESGAUQMW89SXU94LKA/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.muji.us/store/stationery/notebooks/recycled-paper-note-double-ring-b5-plain-80.html\">MUJI Recycled Paper Note (B5)</a><br />$4<br />★★★☆</p><p>The ideal notebook shouldn’t be fussy, should open flat and also be affordable. The notebooks from MUJI achieve all of these things. Made from recycled paper, the sheets are smooth and have a nice, warm color to them. Loses a star for being unremarkable in every way but I suppose that’s what notebooks should be. This is what I use daily for sketching and note taking.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685763498-3M9AWKRP6NO2WT441G2H/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a683e4b0719cb5b562e3\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685763498-3M9AWKRP6NO2WT441G2H/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.apple.com/iphone-6/\">Apple iPhone 6</a><br />$200-400<br />★★★★</p><p>What’s there to say about the iPhone 6? Reviewing a new iPhone is like reviewing a new BMW 3 series. They’ve always been great and most likely always will be. It’s immensely thin, beautifully rounded and now features a larger, more usable screen. If you love using an iPhone, you’ll really love using the iPhone 6. It’s a beautiful phone made beautifully.&#160;</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685805026-MNHX8BPURK2IXGIG6DJ9/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a6ade4b0e0996438b1ba\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685805026-MNHX8BPURK2IXGIG6DJ9/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://store.apple.com/us/product/MGQF2ZM/A/iphone-6-silicone-case-black?fnode=47\">Apple iPhone 6 Silicone Case</a><br />$35<br />★★☆☆</p><p>As always, Apple has released a series of cases for the iPhone 6. This time, they come in both leather and silicone. Having tried both in multiple colors (my coworkers and I have a pool of cases we swap from), I’ve concluded that the silicone case is the way to go. They don’t have issues with dye transfer and are finished nicely in a super matte texture. The design is surprisingly ugly and level of craftsmanship is lower than previous cases though. The finishing of flash on the silicone particularly roughly done.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685869083-EIM0O7A66MOUIYNB6ULJ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"5461a6ede4b0e0996438b243\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1415685869083-EIM0O7A66MOUIYNB6ULJ/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n<p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.elevenpl.us/World-Clock\">11+ World Clock</a><br />$50<br />★★★★</p><p>Run by some of my coworkers, 11+ has been slowly rolling out some beautiful work. The World Clock is their latest creation and features a clever rolling design that allows you to read different time zones. This is how you do simple, cheap, and low volume well. Hardware startups, take note.</p>&#160;&#160;","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Sat, 15 Nov 2014 04:41:14 23:32:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","title":"Leica T + M-Adapter T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH","link":"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/leica-t-m-adapter-t-summilux-m-35mm-f14-asph","description":"<figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Last year, I switched over from the&#160;Sony RX1 to my beloved <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/leica-t\">Leica T</a>. One of the primary reasons for this was the possibility&#160;of using Leica’s extensive catalog of M-mount lenses. As someone that also plans on possibly switching over to an M in the future, the investment on lenses could be argued as somewhat rational. Leica was kind enough and offered to send me a M-Adapter T to try out, and also sent along the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"http://us.leica-camera.com/Photography/Leica-M/M-Lenses/Super-Elmar-M-21mm-f-3.4-ASPH\">Super-Elmar-M 21mm</a>. It was when I tried the Summilux-M 35mm when I&#160;really fell in love with this setup though.</p>&#160;<hr /><p class=\"text-align-center\">DISCLAIMER<br />The M-Adapter T been sent by Leica Camera.</p>&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420923863555-MZXD73VGBDDQIV20BD49/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#38;nbsp;\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b193d6e4b0f176742d8d55\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420923863555-MZXD73VGBDDQIV20BD49/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#160;</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The Leica Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH is arguably the most versatile lens available for the Leica M system. It has the classic journalistic focal length of 35mm and a super fast maximum aperture of f/1.4. Due to this fine balance, this&#160;Summilux&#160;has been one of the most popular lenses for M system. The lens ran for just north of $5000 new and are now approximately $4000 used in flawless condition. These may seem like nonsensical figures but the world’s best glass doesn’t come cheap.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420926057106-LU8J592ZC3N1EWL1H9HU/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b19c67e4b058acae269862\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420926057106-LU8J592ZC3N1EWL1H9HU/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Because Leica is a company so enriched in history, it’s worth providing some historical context for the Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH. This lens was introduced in 1994, replacing the identically named model&#160;from 1990. My Summilux-M 35mm&#160;was sold for 16 years, a testament to its brilliant design, and Leica product's timeless nature. There is a newer version of the lens introduced in 2011 that has the addition of a floating element (FLE) designed to increase performance across various shooting distances. Much like Porsche with the 911, Leica takes an already impressive product and improves it over time.&#160;The Summilux 35mm has always been, and most likely always will be, the best super fast 35mm lens</p><hr />\n<h3>Summilux 35mm timeline</h3>\n<p id=\"yui_3_17_2_3_1420915912299_155624\"><br><strong>Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4&#160;</strong><br>11 870<br>1961 - 1990</p><p><strong>Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH&#160;</strong><br>11 873<br>1990 - 1994</p><p><strong>Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH&#160;</strong><br>11 874, 11 883<br>1994 - 2010</p><p><strong>Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH (FAG)</strong><br>11 663<br>2011 - present</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420445319858-UDSDWOOK03W2UKCUJA5K/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54aa4686e4b09c6fe410dfd6\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420445319858-UDSDWOOK03W2UKCUJA5K/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>For the sake of trivia: if you’re unfamiliar with Leica’s naming convention, the first thing you may wonder is what “Summilux” means. The company has always named its lenses based on their maximum aperture, and in the case of Summilux, it equates lenses that are f/1.4. Here is a chart of the naming convention:</p><hr /><h3>Leica lens trademarks</h3><p>f/0.94-1.2&#160;<br />f/1.4 &#160;&#160;<br />f/2 &#160;<br />f/2.5 &#160;<br />f/2.8 &#160;<br />f/3.5-4 &#160;</p><p><span>Noctilux</span><br /><span>Summilux</span><br /><span>Summicron</span><br /><span>Summarit</span><br /><span>Elmarit<br />Elmar</span></p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420445355873-4KHU9RAVKFBPK67USN3T/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54aa46aae4b09c6fe410e04d\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420445355873-4KHU9RAVKFBPK67USN3T/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Because Leica names lenses based purely on their aperture and not on optical design, they don’t always correlate to lens quality. In general though, the Summicron lenses are&#160;considered to be the best balance of optical quality, speed and price. On the other hand, the Summilux lenses typically go for a premium, offering a larger maximum aperture while sacrificing a little bit of optical clarity in result. The reduction in sharpness and clarity is often&#160;trivial though, a reason for the Summilux-M 35mm’s popularity amongst photographers.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420924737515-Q77V0JQIUMJEMT88V34S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b19740e4b047061239f9cc\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420924737515-Q77V0JQIUMJEMT88V34S/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Since the Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH is an M lens, it requires the Leica M-Adapter T to work with the Leica T. It comes at typically Leica $395 but is made exceptionally well.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420924770665-BAMG5FQGVQHYQW54KZ94/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#38;nbsp;\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b19761e4b086d7955870bb\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420924770665-BAMG5FQGVQHYQW54KZ94/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#160;</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Shooting with an M lens on T is largely an enjoyable experience although it does have its share of minor flaws. First of all, the right dial on the camera becomes locked to ISO settings. Ideally, I would set one to focus aid zoom and the other to exposure compensation but it’s simply not a possibility. I’m hoping this is something that can be addressed using a firmware update</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n        </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420938502579-QZDG40PGDH0EFL6WOUE9/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>But the biggest flaw with using M lenses on the T is that white balance accuracy suffers compared to T lenses. Problems arise especially when shooting under artificial lighting and the camera tends to shoot far too warm for some reason. I usually never shoot in RAW but have started to do so due to the occasional unbalanced photo. When I’m indoors, I sometimes even set the white balance to manual and setup a grey card for the sake of consistency. This is admittedly an annoyance but likely something that can be addressed via a software patch</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img        </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b1cef5e4b03795e39e2770\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420938999130-JJ63STV2B3WXKC1TOCDE/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/20150110-L1000003-2.jpg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Other than those two quirks. using the Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH with the T is a brilliant experience. The Visoflex for Leica T is also sharp enough for pretty accurate focusing. It’s so sharp that 90% of the time, I don’t even use any focus aids.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420926359801-6CBPB6HKX0O32ZU2TPNX/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#38;nbsp;\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b19d96e4b05f5af8f7f023\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420926359801-6CBPB6HKX0O32ZU2TPNX/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#160;</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I purchased my Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH used from a seller in Japan. It’s in like-new condition and I wasn’t even able to find any signs of use. Here’s a tip: Japan is a great place to buy used products - they’re often times valued lower there and Japanese consumers take very good care of their belongings.&#160;</p><p>Like most Leica lenses, the Summilux-M 35mm comes included with a hood. Notice the cut-out for M users (so the hood doesn’t block too much of the viewfinder). The hood is made of plastic but the lens is constructed from brass, giving it a nice heft, embracing the Wetzlar’s typical rendition of quality.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420924685509-XFB288YS5YVDX6L7A03W/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#38;nbsp;\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b1970ce4b08d0f48c3f9ee\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420924685509-XFB288YS5YVDX6L7A03W/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#160;</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>As usual, the Leica Summilux 35mm offers great ergonomics and feel. The aperture ring clicks with a typical german sense of tactility and the focus ring is made with the same precision as a fine watch. Holding a classic Leica lens makes you realize how we’ve surrounded ourselves with garbage products. It’s no wonder Leica lenses are&#160;used for decades.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420926322337-QUII8P562XFXJI6QOOSE/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#38;nbsp;\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b19d71e4b0d4dc5ec1c441\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420926322337-QUII8P562XFXJI6QOOSE/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summicron-T 23mm f/2&#160;</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>To those new to Leica M lenses, yes, these are operated completely manually. This can be a little bit intimidating at first but because the focusing dial is so ergonomically intuitive, it’s easier than it sounds. Like a car with a manual transmission, the interaction is a purely mechanical one, and digital latency is non-existent. I find it to be a refreshing, vital experience.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420927397067-QJNRREBFQRLU3QLQ39X8/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Shooting at f/1.4 is an awesome experience. Shallow depth of field is of course a big benefit of a large aperture and one of the prime reasons for selecting the Summilux over the Summicron for me. Although a lens is more about what is in focus than not, there are definitely situations where shallow depth of field comes in handy as a visual tool. Other than a little bit of vignetting (which can easily be corrected in post), the images are also&#160;technically impressive wide open.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420445461899-J8EU7BQK2WJ7E0GQ0ZA0/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>I’m not sure why (or how) this is the case but there seems to be a noticeable difference in the rendition of color between using T and M lenses. The fact that I’ve switched to shooting in RAW is a big influence but regardless of this, I’ve been noticing smoother and calmer color, particularly in environments that test the sensor’s dynamic range capabilities.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The most surprising thing about shooting with the Summilux was how different the images <em>feel</em> compared to my Summicron-T&#160;23mm. People always talk about the “Leica Look” and&#160;it's a largely frivolous discussion, especially in the digital age. Regardless of this,&#160;I’m starting to feel like the Leica aesthetic surfaces from the rendition of color and shadows via&#160;M lenses. The Summicron-T&#160;23mm is a fantastic lens but to make the most out of your Leica T’s sensor, I highly recommend buying an M lens to complement it.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n        </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The most practical application of a fast lens is of course,&#160;in low-light shooting. f/2 is probably enough for most situations but f/1.4 really lets you push the boundaries of where you can photograph. ISO performance has come a long ways but nothing beats a fast lens.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54aa4645e4b03d35acd3132b\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420445255149-U6986HNV27A5EGSFSNFD/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>The Summilux-M 35mm is notorious for its sheer optical clarity and it doesn’t disappoint in practice. Details render razor sharp and light penetrates through the lens as if it's made of&#160;diamond; it’s what makes shooting with the lens so entertaining. Especially with a subject like a car, the reflections and waves of light&#160;become so crisp and clear that they turn into a fireworks show.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b19f7de4b04905168d5f30\" data-type=\"image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n data-image-dimensions=\"1200x795\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54aa4895e4b0d88dbdbab994\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420445847083-14J5UPHA2BMNHM2KH0WM/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kEiREASJXjyg0FkDBg-2yS8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKc1K8ldZA7K2WotbX7g-T4rwDJL9JhGS5fgJhTOZomK_ZCeT-Z1M3jcJV0yIxIoKKg/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Because the Leica T has a APS-C sized sensor, the Summilux-M 35mm is comparable to a 50mm when cropped. This means that the lens actually ends up being pretty great for portraits. The Summicron-T&#160;23mm is still the best everyday setup though. If you're interested in buying M lenses for the T, I'd highly recommend trying them out at a store to see if the focal distance makes sense for you.</p>&#160;&#160;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420927437420-19D3CBAIYPL3KO2Z3OR0/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x1812\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"54b1a1cae4b007479df808e5\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1420927437420-19D3CBAIYPL3KO2Z3OR0/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kBAE06WE9BJ1KHE_Nv6YMpd7gQa3H78H3Y0txjaiv_0fDoOvxcdMmMKkDsyUqMSsMWxHk725yiiHCCLfrh8O1z5QHyNOqBUUEtDDsRWrJLTmi7D7yXkH8nfwsxTs5kW9h5RcOmjuJfCQWzSyE056GCoYs9moKtaxRuOOh3CnOA3F/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n          \n          <figcaption class=\"image-caption-wrapper\">\n            <p><span>Leica T + Summilux-M 35mm f/1.4 ASPH</span></p>\n          </figcaption>\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;<p>Photography has changed immensely in the past decade. For most people, their phone is the only camera they need and often times the only one they carry. However, the realities of the nature of light is something that won’t ever change. The Leica M mount is something that has been largely unchanged since 1954 and the lenses designed for this platform are still considered as some of the best optics in the world.&#160;Shooting with a manual M lens has been&#160;a bit of a revelation for me. You become a part of the machine, affecting it mechanically, having direct influence on the light that will eventually hit the sensor. It makes you a more considerate shooter, and helps you understand the magic that happens underneath the brass casing. There is a convenience you get from shooting with the Summicron-T&#160;23mm but if you own a Leica T, I highly recommend investing in an M-Adapter T and a nice M Summicron or Summilux lens. It’s the essence of photography. Intimate, tactile and simple.</p>&#160;&#160;","descriptionType":"text/html","publishedDate":"Mon, 12 Jan 2015 01:30:15 23:32:35","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 23:32:35","title":"Vancouver | MM Travel Guide | 15","link":"http://www.minimallyminimal.com/blog/vancouver-mm-travel-guide-15","description":"<p>Mosquito<br />32 Water Street<br />★★★★<br />$$$</p><p>This is one of my favorite places in Vancouver right now. Mosquito does everything perfectly. A great drinks list, delicious menu, beautiful decor, comfortable atmosphere, and smooth but not uncomfortably attentive service. They specialize in desserts and cocktails but also offer other small plates like a charcuterie board. The desserts are generally light and not overly sweet or heavy, which is always a plus. Presentation is top notch and the combination of textures and flavors are universally interesting. The wine and champagne lists are relatively compact but curated well and should satisfy the fussiest palate.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />The champagne of the day (if available) comes at a discount and is paired with a small bite to eat.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450841786653-EAQH1RXIX3W3590RN6ML/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"567a16b9d82d5ee2f7c23912\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450841786653-EAQH1RXIX3W3590RN6ML/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>Bao Bei<br />163 Keefer Street<br />★★★☆<br />$$</p><p>Vancouver’s Chinatown and its neighboring streets can get pretty sketchy but its fringes have become increasingly trendy. Bao Bei is a perfect example of this. It’s a modern-Chinese restaurant with clear Vietnamese and French influences, all with a contemporary mindset. Food is exceptional here, and reminds me of my favorite modern-Asian restaurants like Joule in Seattle. Although some dishes came off a bit busy, the good ones were tremendous, like the Shao Bing (flatbread sandwich) and dumplings. I here the pork belly is to die for here as well, although I haven't tried it yet.&#160;The interior decor is done well too, and feels hip without feeling manufactured. If you're in the area, this one is a must visit.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />Bao Bei doesn’t take reservations. I’d go on a Sunday night to avoid waiting too long.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"567c49079cadb6554dab62e6\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450985737605-5S82RUFZDX0588AE0JDO/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>Pronto<br />3473 Cambie Street<br />★☆☆☆<br />$$</p><p>Aesthetically, Pronto looks like it may be the best Italian restaurant in the world. It’s beautifully executed with bold typography and honest materials. But it isn't. The pasta is overcooked, bland and watery. The appetizers are better but not enough to save this place.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />Although this is an Italian restaurant, don't get the pastas here.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450985958136-384VE4JLSLFVH27B1YYO/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"567c49e4c21b864703026e53\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450985958136-384VE4JLSLFVH27B1YYO/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>Chambar<br />568 Beatty Street<br />★★★☆<br />$$</p><p>Chambar is a well-known brunch spot in Vancouver and it’s easy to see why. It’s a place that is kept and run impeccably, without being too fussy or pretentious. Belgian influences serve as the undertone with inspiration coming from Colombian cuisine. The plates are vibrant and clean. Freshness seems to be a key element with bright herbs and vegetables usually completing dishes. The unique soft and chewy waffles are really good here, and can be ordered with a selection of tasty sauces like salted caramel or chocolate pistachio rosewater.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />The perfect brunch: order a main per person and a few waffles to share.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"567c4a8ab204d52319a54c55\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450986124544-K0ZD2VNAIJYLLO0RWL7K/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>Revolver<br />325 Cambie St<br />★★☆☆<br />$$</p><p>I can call Revolver one of Vancouver’s best coffee shops but I’ll also mention that it isn’t a city with excellent coffee in general. Revolver has a rough and analog aesthetic and staff that seems to truly care about coffee. The drinks are made with care and skill but the beans are honestly not that great. Despite their large bean selection, the drinks felt a bit one dimensional and overall too bright in flavor. One of the great things about Revolver is their tasting flight, which is always a fun thing to do. But once again, this is let down by their coffee selection. I’m still not going to hesitate recommending this place. After all, their espressos are excellent.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />Next door to Revolver is a coffee merchandise store called Archive. They're physically connected and you're welcome to sit and drink your coffee there.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450986268428-9RBEZYODSAGIJH0OILKT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"567c4b19e0327cd48aca5f12\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450986268428-9RBEZYODSAGIJH0OILKT/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>Timbertrain<br />311 W Cordova St<br />★★★☆<br />$</p><p>Timbertrain is currently my favorite coffee shop in Vancouver. They make great, delicate pour-overs and rich espressos. Although Revolver offers more technical skill, Timbertrain seems to have bean curation that suits my tastebuds better. The selection is more diverse in flavor, ranging from the bright and fruity to rich and chocolatey. I also really like the Japanese ceramic cups that the coffee is served in and the table-focused seating design that resembles train interiors.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />They have free sparkling water on tap. What more do you want?</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450986496040-40PKCQYMA2ZAM7RGFKIO/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"567c4bfec647adf832e8c692\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450986496040-40PKCQYMA2ZAM7RGFKIO/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>Small Victory<br />1088 Homer Street<br />★★★★<br />$$</p><p>Finding Small Victory truly feels like a victorious thing. They are a bakery/cafe and have a good selection of desserts and pastries. The croissants are flaky and crisp and the desserts and cakes are all executed impeccably. I wouldn’t call them the best I’ve had, but that’s only because I’ve been to Paris. To top it off, the coffee here is pretty good as well, with a nice selection for pour-overs and solid espressos. For those who prefer tea, there’s a rotating menu of those as well. The interior is modern and clean, although the busy decorative gold elements do bother me a bit. The generous use of marble and light wood is attractive though, and I really like the bar seats that circle the baristas. The tables at Small Victory are really large so I actually prefer the bar seats when I visit with someone I actually want to talk to. Small Victory is one of those rare places that seem to do everything with near perfection and I would easily consider it one of my favorite places in the city.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />Don’t go expecting a seat here, this place is often packed. The best time to visit is an hour or two before closing time.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450950143577-AE1481GEEDRWT2T0EQFO/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"567bbdfd40667a315352311d\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450950143577-AE1481GEEDRWT2T0EQFO/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>Kirin<br />555 W 12th Avenue<br />★★★☆<br />$$</p><p>Bad service and decor seems to be unavoidable with dimsum restaurants. This one is no exception but more tolerable compared to others. Despite the utter chaos that ensues, the restaurant is run by staff that are well practiced and completely unfazed by the hoards of hungry and loud clientele. You’re seated at a surprisingly reasonable speed and although your server may accidentally bring you the wrong dish, the food itself makes up for most of the faults. The dishes are done in a classic style, and with a higher level of expertise and care than other joints in the city. Kirin may not be the best Chinese restaurant I've been to, but after much searching, I can confidently say that this is the best place for dimsum in the city.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />If you call last minute for a table, they’ll say they’re fully booked. Walk-in, and it'll likely just be a 30 minute wait.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n class=\"thumb-image\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450949079759-X4AT9AUIJ2PYLHV7HCC3/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x800\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"567bb9d62399a36b8ed15a36\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450949079759-X4AT9AUIJ2PYLHV7HCC3/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kPqQfq0L3n3wpHIsRapTfg8UqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKczo5Zn4xktlpMsMj-QlHXeMfNK6GwvtVkYEWiR8XAPyD3GfLCe_DXOSC_YcAacWL_/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>Rain or Shine<br />3382 Cambie Street<br />★★★☆<br />$$</p><p>Quality ice-cream parlors seem to be popping up everywhere these days. Rain or Shine is one of them, and offers a similar product you'd find at other ice-cream specialists; creamy, thick ice-cream made using local ingredients. Their flavors are categorized by two sections called “Keepers” and “Seasonal Flings”, the latter being the special seasonal menu. I really enjoy their ice-cream, but it's somewhat generic. You can find better ice-cream elsewhere in the city, but some of the seasonal flings are really creative, making Rain or Shine memorable. The confused, unwelcoming decor is a big annoyance, because it really hurts the otherwise delightful experience. All things considered though, this one is a keeper.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />Go in the winter and they may have fir flavored ice-cream. It’s awesome.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n        \n        \n\n        \n          \n            \n          \n            <img class=\"thumb-image\" data-image=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450917937853-H82UNQT9MSKZGQXKN3WB/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kA3tZ5TBy1f_sssSpWXOW9YUqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKcgaDdHRCwla1CYve_F_LBwmejBVuDzJogBoUdQAfTdD_f0Ty7a9CYUPP6wumdY9dP/image-asset.jpeg\" data-image-dimensions=\"1200x815\" data-image-focal-point=\"0.5,0.5\" alt=\"\" data-load=\"false\" data-image-id=\"567b402e0ab37790ca47ef32\" data-type=\"image\" src=\"https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/50271a61c4aab6c54f9af5ee/1450917937853-H82UNQT9MSKZGQXKN3WB/ke17ZwdGBToddI8pDm48kA3tZ5TBy1f_sssSpWXOW9YUqsxRUqqbr1mOJYKfIPR7LoDQ9mXPOjoJoqy81S2I8N_N4V1vUb5AoIIIbLZhVYxCRW4BPu10St3TBAUQYVKcgaDdHRCwla1CYve_F_LBwmejBVuDzJogBoUdQAfTdD_f0Ty7a9CYUPP6wumdY9dP/image-asset.jpeg?format=1000w\" />\n          \n        \n          \n        \n\n        \n      \n        </figure>\n      \n\n    \n  \n\n\n\n&#160;&#160;<p>UYU<br />433 Abbott St<br />★★★☆<br />$$</p><p>UYU is a small soft serve ice-cream parlor named after the Korean word for milk. It's a small shop with a modern aesthetic that feels a bit derivative and and cheap, but their product is solid. Simplicity is key to UYU’s success, highlighted by their minimal menu (there’s only a selection of a few flavors and a tasteful selection of toppings and drizzles). The quality of their soft serve makes UYU truly worth the visit - it’s light, fresh, not too sweet, and tastes heavily of milk. It really is good enough to eat without toppings, although those are great as well.</p><p>Tip<br /><span>—</span><br />The honey drizzle pairs beautifully with the freeze-dried fruits on the milk soft serve.</p>\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n \n\n  \n  \n    \n\n      \n\n      \n        <figure class=\"\n              sqs-block-image-figure\n              intrinsic\n            \"\n        >\n          \n
